description: I like Casanova because it's not too crowded, it has couches, and it's larger than your average sf bar so you don't feel crammed in. There were some way bitchy bartenders though (i.e. girl bartenders who ignore the girl patrons, carding me when i've been there for 3 hours with a large group all with people over 30, oh and when i am NOT DRINKING, nor ordering a drink, and laying down the snotty attitude on my friends). I would up it another star otherwise.
author: Nikki M.

description: Never digged this place all that much, even before it became a hipster douchebag bar. It is still barely tolerable on a Mon-Thurs, but their beer selection completely sucks now.
author: Jim B.

description:
(I'm not a bar hopper type person so just remember that when reading this and give my review whatever weight you will).

I dug this place! Very cool winding bar with nifty grape lamps overhead. Kind of dim but I think that's kind of the point in bars. Really like the whole couch thing, makes it easier to talk with your companions too since you have to pretty much shout or lean in close to be heard. Comfy bouncy couches are my friend. LOVE the gorgeous nekked lady paintings everywhere, gives the place a real sexy vibe.

Minus one star for being too loud, even if the music being played WAS good stuff (any place that plays Weezer songs off the Pinkerton disc is alright in my book) and minus one star for both of the drinks I had here being weaker than I'm used to. Tasted excellent but didn't get the instantaneous buzz I was hoping for.
author: Christine K.

description:
I can NOT tolerate bars with 25 TVs blaring sporty ESPN nonsence while women wearing copious amounts of eye shadow try to interest fat, beer bloated men.  Thank God I don't live in Cleveland, Ohio.

Thank god I do live in San Francisco, where people hang out at dark, vibey bars and don't care to be seen wearing outfits adorned with sequins.  I am not a fan of sequins, or anything thing shimmery.

I would like to see you walk into Casanova wearing sequins and shimmery blue eye shadow. I believe you would feel out of place.

This is more of a 'don't bother to shower before heading out the door' place.  And even though I would prefer if more people in SF showered, I vastly prefer the unshowered to the overly sequinsed.
author: Krissy M.

description:
How can I give a bad review to a place where I got so much (admittedly drink and drug-induced) attention from the opposite sex?

Came in here with some friends and it was DARK (but apparently not dark enough - one of my female friends proceeded to chastise me for having a chubster in the middle of the bar, which I didn't -- waitaminit -- was that some sort of twisted complement?) Whatever. 

It was crowded though and the drinks were strong. Went out for a smoke and you know the routine -- within 47 seconds someone's leeching a cig, except the someone is cute and sticks around and chats me up and her pupils are the size of SAUCERS -- and then  her tiny but also cute friend after saying like two words is giving me a very nice back rub and I'm thinking "Thank you, German scientist Hug Drug inventor!" Anyhow , we ended up heading off somewhere else, so I wished my new Doe-eyed friends a good night.

So yeah I know, that was a little random and had like zero to do with the quality of this venue. But I like places with friendly people. This place has friendly people. Very friendly.
author: Karsten P.

description:
This place is great up until about 10:30 when they start sending the express bus from Union to Valencia street. Jesus, if I wanted bro-dudes in collared shirts I'd go to the Bus Stop or The Matrix. Please do us all a favor you fuck-headed people and stay out of the good bars. 

Other than that, Casanova is a chill divey kinda bar with some great beers on tap, good music and (usually) isn't too crowded. 

A word to the wise, unless you are looking for a shoulder-to-shoulder cock-fest, stay away on Thursday-Saturday late nights.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Chill bar, cheap drinks, cool nudie art on the walls.  All-in-all a pretty sweet place to kick it.  

Friends and I went this past week.  After freezing our asses off at Zeitgeist (a worthwhile sacrifice for cheap food and delish drinks) we decided to head indoors.  I'd never been to Casanova but was pleasantly surprised.  Minus 1 star for being a bit crowded and hard to find a seat for the first 20 min or so AND for playing pretty wack music.  BUT, I did randomly run into a friend from high school.  That may not seem like much, but I grew up in Fresno so it's quite a distance to "run into" old classmates.  Though, I must say, a whole lot of us Fresnans successfully made the trek to the bay.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
It was really really wet and sticky on the floor - gross! Then we got our drinks and I saw why - filled to the brim!  OK, forgiven.

This space is LOUD LOUD LOUD and macho... but if you want to party with friends at a bar in the Misssion, what less do you want?  PLUS the drinks were fantastic.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Yeah... good times. Fun crowd, busy often, quick drinks... strong drinks. And dude, I left my umbrella there and they kept it for me to pickup. That's nice... 

Go to the ladies' room. Great works of literature on those walls. And watch out for the burly alcoholics that fall over at your feet. Time to get crazy and party maaaaaaan.
author: Ash G.

description:
Read here for LitQuake the other night!

Great happy hour, chill vibe with the naked lady paintings.  

However, expect a dive bar bathroom.
author: Rocky C.

description:
First off this low rating is due to the poor bartender who refused to serve my boyfriend and my friend after looking at their out of state ID's.  

My friend was in town for a conference and I wanted to take him to the best place to drink in the city, which of course is the mission!  So we went to the Mission after going to 111 Minna, which was awesome but closes too early.  So after going to the Elbow Room my Misson staple, we decided to hop on over to the Casanova.

At first I thought it was the Make out Room with a new name because the decor and set up was so similar.  I realized the differences between it and the Make Out Room when I interacted with the bartender who I will call Bruce.  Bruce took our orders, poured our beers, handed over said beers, and then asked for our ids.  After already having given us our drinks he stared at our ID's like he was staring into someone's eyes, after about three minutes he looked over and said he didn't believe our id's were real.   Mine was fine because it's a Cali license, but my two male companions were in question because they were out of state.

After telling my friend that he didn't sound like he was from Missouri he said he wouldn't serve us again.  Just like that no more beers at this bar. This would of been ok if our ID's were fake, but they aren't! 

Our interactions with Bruce didn't end here either, no he decided he was going to walk past us "to get something" and then glare at us while we attempted to enjoy our beers.

Final thought, Bruce sucks, this was my friend's first trip to SF and it was the night before my birthday... Thus, Casanova is dead to me.
author: Meghan A.

description:
Come on people it is a swanky dive what do you expect!  The lovely velvet ladies on the walls starring at your drinks rock!  The red couches and dim lighting  fit the place.  Sit in a corner with your favorite peeps and chat the night away.  Good drinks, nice wine selection for the buck.  Bump into all those people you see around the city and never knew.  

Loud but hey that's what you came for right?  Also lots of room and slammin tunes to sway to.
author: Velvet V.

description: A good, chill hipster bar. Perfect for a divey happy hour. The Butte Porter on tap doesn't hurt.
author: Andrew K.

description: Weird decor of naked women on their walls doesn't seem to keep out the female patrons. Decent selection of beers and chill bar scene.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Well stocked bar.  Reasonable drink prices.  

Nice layout.  Good sized bar, lots of small tables, a couple of couches, and even enough space to stand by the wall w/o being groped, set your brew on the corner shelf, and admire the sweet nude staring down at you. 

And what nudes they are!  Tastefully done renditions of some seriously bodacious babes!  

My fave is the one of the turquoise chick lying down against a black background in - very Noir-ish.
author: randolph m.

description:
The only Casanova I've ever met here was hanging on the wall with a wicked velvet mustache... the rest of the men, however, were not necessarily synonymous with seduction. A bit horny - but by no means were they Casanovas. Hipster chicks beware! 

(God, I love this place.)
author: Katelin H.

description:
God I hated this place. Like the 7th circle of hell. Cheesy dudes in striped shirts, bachelorette party girls acting a fool, loud music - are we still in college? Cause I'm not. 

So F this place.
author: Jenn H.

description:
Five Star jukebox. DJs are usually quite good. Excellent space and cool kitschy decor. As mentioned by other savvy reviewers, the lighting here is sexy. If you don't drink moderately, you could wind up making out with me.

The crowd here on weeknights is largely 30-something regulars and friends of the bartenders. Thursday through Saturday it's about 80% Bridge And Tunnel douchebags in their early 20s.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
I'm partial to the Casanova Lounge because I'm part of the extended Hemlock/Casanova family as a former employee and current deejay (last Friday of the month). 

I can see the reasons why people would avoid coming in here on some weekends when it is packed, but this bar- even before I worked there- was a great place to hang out in an eclectic crowd and listen to some great music. As far as cute prospects are concerned, I think the Casanova Lounge offers a little something for everyone.

If you're looking for a lively bar on the weekends, this is your place. The weeknights are a little tamer depending on who is deejaying, but is a great place to sit down with some friends and talk.

How can you have anything but love for the naked ladies and hispanic Burt Reynolds on the wall?!?
author: Ben R.

description:
Dude, the bathroom walls say it all. 

I love the couches.. very loungeworthy. The bartenders are pretty nice after you buy a couple of rounds... fine by me. Work sucks, i know. 

Happy hour prices are pretty decent. And the atmosphere can get a little rowdy but that's all good.
author: Eugenia Y.

description:
Had dinner plans in the Mission and was a bit early so we decided to dip into Casanova. My buddy had been there a few times and said it was a chill place to get a few drinks and I have to say I was impressed. I don't want to say it's a typical Mission bar (whatever that is) but it's a bar that you would picture when you are talking about going out there. 
Great pictures on the back wall and the music was decent (although really loud) and fast service. Bring cash.
Side note: I was sitting there waiting for a beer when a decent looking chic came up ordered a double shot of Tequila pounded it, left a $10 and was out the door. NICE.
author: Stephen K.

description:
Ok, so ZI guess this is sort of a "loose" review since I went in on a Friday night at Last Call and didn't notice the paintings everyone is talking about. We stayed away from it early on because my friend said it looked busier then usual. But eventually we had to mee the other friends who wanted the cheap pitcher at last call. 
I met a couple of interesting characters. I do like the cozy sitting arrangements, the couches and such but it just seems they need more.
It was totally overran by hipsters and Marina kids, that made it kind of hell and yet quite entertaining (did I mention it was last call?) so you could imagine.
I am thankful we didn't go sooner, I would've killed someone I am sure!
So...
Probably not a good place to go to on a weekend night if you don't like that kind of scene or crowd.
I think I may try a weeknight and see if it's really as cozy as it appears it could be!
author: Jason K.

description:
If I had written this review 3-4 years ago, it wouldve been 5 stars, but you lose a star for a couple things: 

+ goddamn the weekend crowd. damn you for taking up my usual old stool and ordering a freaking mojito or something that takes incredibly too long to make.  i know its great for business but i hate how crowded it gets now on weekends.

+ i am one of the few who probaby misses the pool table. i know i will be in the minority 

+ kevin and james aren't DJing on thursdays anymore? TRAVESTY. they will be missed.

other then those things, i love the casanova. love it to pieces, especially right after work on something like a Tuesday.
author: Olivia W.

description:
I always get way too drunk here! Not sure if it's the drinks or that the time seems to fly when I'm there.

Cool mixed crowd. Friendly bartenders. Pretty decent music most of the time.
author: Sadie S.

description:
Nothing says I am having a great time rolling on a monday evening like Sweet Child o' Mine blasting through the jukebox.  Although this is 'just another dive bar in the mission'  I have to say I appreciate the fact that there were no bicycles parked inside.  I really enjoyed the comfy couches, and especially liked the fact that T and T means Tanqueray on the rocks with a splash of tonic.  
The only reason they only get four stars is that besides the one hot chick at the bar who was proverbially waiting for her boyfriend, eyecandy was non existant.
author: international super bert a.

description:
Well, mixed feelings. Pluses - good space, good crowd, good DJ. Beer selection was definitely above par. Minuses - was often difficult to get a drink. Alanna the bartendrix would have to be motioned by her conversation partners to notice there was a customer waiting to order. More than once. With not just me but others.

Yanno, if you want someone to turn into a regular you've got to treat them well the first time they come in. Yes I tipped, wasn't hammered / acting like a tool, etc. etc. It's just disappointing to get kinda lousy service on a quiet Sunday afternoon in a place I would otherwise give more stars. I mean, I was treated better at Zeitgeist and they were totally packed. YMMV, and I'll likely give it another try, but there it is.
author: Mark W.

description: Lots of dark corners for doing naughty deeds;0p lol! No but really....nice open space, the lighting makes everyone look super hot and the paintings on the wall remind me of a few paintings my parents have at home;0)
author: Veronika O.

description: Great on the weekdays. way too crowded on the weekends. Good drinks, good diggs
author: Caitlin F.

description:
Was there Sunday after being chased away from an over packed Zeitgeist.  Very cool space.  My friend and I took up residence at the raised stage in the back.  Extremely good location for watching the social pavan ensue.   DJ was inattentive (a few songs played twice in a row), but the music was most cool.

Only downside was the anomic bartender.  While regulars seems to get near instant service, I had to wait until she finished talking with her friends before she would serve me.  Often only if a regular also showed up (and they would be served first even if I was already waiting!).  Not a cool move girlfriend.
author: William S.

description: Decent joint. I like that they've got a large lounge area to hangout. Music was danceable- kinda old school 80s hip hop and rock. No attitudes here, and everyones having a great time.
author: Thomas L.

description:
I'm the type of person who - when they're running low on drinking funds, heads to the Mission for cheap - strong - drinks at good prices, Casanova Lounge is one of those places.

It gets pretty tight and crowded on the weekends, but Tuesday threw Thursday is chill.

Can't really complain.  Not my favorite but a good place to stop off for a drink or two on your way to blackout alley.
author: Lauren G.

description:
If I ONLY saw Casanova's bathroom, I'd think it was the sleaziest dive in the city. Unfortunately, that isn't the case.

As it stands, Casanova is more like Beauty Bar Lite, minus the dancing.

When it's crowded, it can be pretty irritating, so avoid it on the weekends if you can, or crowdsurf at your own peril.
author: Pete J.

description:
This place reminds me of myself as a teenager.....

(as recounted by the follks)

"You have so much potential and you are wasting it!"
"We have given you everything you need to suceed. (location, booze, nice lighting) What is the problem?"
author: Thadd L.

description:
Remember that can of warm soda you drank last February? Remember how awesome it was? How fun? No, you say? You don't recollect? It was an altogether forgettable experience? Wha?!?

Apparently, Casanova's happy hour evokes the same non-emotion in me. If it wasn't for one quiet drunk instructing the bartender on the proper use of the word "fonky", I might have forgotten entirely. Oh, also what passed for a debate on the merits of mail order brides. Pure class.

Everything else...is..a blur. Just not the booze fueled kind.
author: Jim Z.

description:
Pretty chill bar. Sometimes the music can be hit or miss. The naughty pictures on the wall are intriguing. 

I like this bar to hang out with when the hipsters aren't all out, which is not very often! The beer is cheap (for SF at least), the bartenders are cool, and the people are usually all laid back! As with any bathroom in the city, STAY FAR FAR AWAY!! 
Us guys have it lucky and just have to aim, or barely if you're that inebriated! lol

Cassanova lounge brings sexy back... to about a 1970 bordello!
author: Eric A.

description:
Decent bar in the Mission that usually plays good music. That can be hard to find sometimes. It can be hard to escape the top 40, dance/club bullsh*t that people are into these days for some reason.

Not grade A, but decent.
author: Christina S.

description:
I like this spot after work when its not yet crowded and you can sit at the bar, make friends with the locals.  I also like this spot as a no brainer for a weekend.  Its always crowded and there's guaranteed a nice handful of cute boys.  We like to watch the Marina kids when they stumble in accidentally, and then we time em to see how long they last.  It's a favorite past time really.  

What I don't like, and this has nothing to do with Casanova but usually occurs en route to Casanova, is the tool trying to sell his pen drawn pictures for his daughter Ashley.  You know who I'm talking about.  Has anyone ever seen Ashley?  Seriously?  That dude sucks.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Hipster Central!

I should have stocked up at American Apparel and raided my old 80's gear before I came!

I didn't think there was anything special about the bar. It was cheap, and felt like any other hipster bar in the Mission. I did enjoy Australia Day there and ran into some Australians, which made the night a bit more interesting than the drab hipster clothes/accessories, but otherwise, this place was just mehhhhh.

I might have to upstage the hipsters here one day, just you wait....!
author: Rocky K.

description:
Amazingly bad service.  I  have been to many bars in many cities, my friends.  I have even been to places where bad service is part of "draw" (yeah I don't get that either).  But I have never before been to a place where the bartender purposefully sprayed a customer with hot water.  Isn't that some kind of illegal?

My own drink was not what I asked for (the important thing) and a young guy at the end of the bar got his ID checked by every single bartender (they just weren't paying attention).  Simply record-setting levels of unprofessional.
author: Eartha K.

description:
Pros:
Cool staff.
Laid back vibe.
Usually never crowded.
Decent prices.

Cons:
Too dark.
Too dark.
Too dark.
Room has wierd flow (the bar juts out and it can be hard to see that there's a whole back section which is comparatively empty)
author: Andy A.

description: Pretty cool lounge.  Lots of seating, lots of space.  Lurid decorations.
author: Danny C.

description:
I can see why it's for some people, but it isn't for me.  Went there last night, and it was just loud.  The drink was fine, nothing special, maybe a little heavy on the ice.  We chilled for our drink and decided to head on out to somewhere less obnoxiously loud.   Loud from people talking and having a great time is fine, but this was just music played too loud for the sake of playing it too loud.

Great, now you've got my night of drinking in the city turning into a cranky, old man.  Thanks, Casanova.  Damn kids with their hippedy hop musics.
author: David F.

description:
I've always had a decent time at Casanova. The pictures on the wall make me blush a little bit. 
The only knock on the place is the wait to get a drink. There are few bars that have made me wait this long for a cheap beer. I'm purely rating Casanova on weekend experiences as well. Just so that you know. I have been here about 12 times in the last few years, but every time has been on a Friday or Saturday. I really need to give it a shot on a weekday. I'll re-review after a happy hour session. 
PS - I had typed "happy hour sesh" and then realized how much I hate when that word is abbreviated. I'm not sure why.
author: Mike M.

description:
Was in and out in a jiffy. 

I remember liking some of the bar hangings; festive and had me thinking fondly of the three kings. The bartender gave me a questionable glance when I asked for water in my vodka-gimlet; I made him watch when I took the first sip. A pronounced face of contentment; he'll understand now.
author: Marc M.

description:
I just stared bleakly into the depths of my computer for several minutes, trying to remember the name of this place.  And I've probably been there at least 10 times.  That should tell you how generic it is.  Honestly, I don't see hipsters there.  I see sad girls with 9 to 5s who just want someone to love them.  Maybe that's because I was there on Valentine's Day.  Maybe that's because I am one.  What?  

There is nothing wrong or right about this bar.  I find it totally adequate to drink in.
author: Coco D.

description:
Our regular Mission haunt.  One time, I talked to God outside of this place, he wanted some of my pizza but I was like "ahh, hell nah hell nah hell nah."  He told me his son was the singer from Third Eye Blind, which was pretty crazy....the lead singer of a crappy pop band being the descendant of God and all.

Inside Casanova you'll find surly bartenders with oddly shaped haircuts, a bunch of weird lamps and shit hanging from the ceilings, a pretty cool lounge area towards the back with lots of sofas and a special section that's kind of draped off and looks like it would be reserved for VIP's if those type of people actually came to Casanova.

Their drinks are stiff, really stiff, stiff to the point of rigormortis.  There are women here, sometimes they're cute, sometimes they too have oddly shaped haircuts.
author: Josh T.

description: Drinks are on the strong side and not too expensive.  I've always had a fun time here - it's always on our "Mission" bar hopping list.
author: Kristen S.

description: Inexpensive, Strong drinks, friendly bartenders and lots of regulars here.  There is definitely good energy here, the last time I came here two different people I just met gave me hugs before I left.   We make new friends every time we come here.
author: Charla M.

description:
BOOBS!

Boobs boobs everywhere... on the walls at least.  Lots of paintings with "realistic" boobs but funny cartoony hands and other details.

Overheard while sitting on a leather couch "You know, the people of San Francisco are the most fashionable in the world - more than New York or Paris". My friend looked at me and said "Maybe the most fashion per dollar spent... but I'm going to take that as a personal compliment"
author: Maia B.

description: We went here on a Sunday night, and this place was cool, it had a nice mixed crowd, relaxed environment with cool art. Seemed like the kind of place you would have to bring your own entertainment with you (in the form of a couple of your own friends) since there wasn't much mingling, but I didn't mind, it was relaxing.  There was an adorable bartender named Margarita who made us a tequila, rose something or other, and man oh man was it tasty.
author: Deanna W.

description:
I found standing room where people weren't pushing past me every 5 seconds.  
Service was extremely quick, we had a second bartender try to help us after the first was getting our drinks.  That's amazing.
Dark lighting was great for hiding the huge run in my nylons.
author: Light Bulb J.

description:
BAR-One of my favorite places.  Definitely dig the lounge feel.  Dark and almost seedy, but not.  It's got a SF hipster vibe.  But certainly not pretentious.  Dig the lighting fixtures.  Artwork...maybe not so much.

I'm not a big beer drinker, but reliable sources say Casanova's selection is certainly above average.  As for my fav. (these days) - Manhattan.  It is most certainly solid!  To be perfectly honest I love Casanova because it is casual and reliable....

Jukebox selection???  To be continued.
author: Mercedes R.

description: Only having been here once on a Sunday I can say it felt like being in art school again. Definitely the art type crowd stuffed into a dimly, lit, almost artist's co-op studio space. The DJ was mixing motown and the Guinness was $4/pop. Not a bad way to spend the last waking minutes of your weekend.
author: Kim N.

description: Good fun crowd, only problem is that every group looks the same (mission hipsters, funky glasses, mixed race couples, etc) that you may wander up to the wrong people by accident and start making jokes before you realize, it's not your friends -- but they'd understand, since they're talking about the same things too
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Stopped by this place last night with some friends and was happy with what I found.  Plenty of seating, cool/fast bartenders that pour strong drinks, and decent beer tap selection.  This is a bar I could totally see myself becoming a regular at if I lived in the neighborhood.

[update] 8.12.07 
Been here twice more since I posted this review and I take back that "I could be a regular here" comment.  The problem isn't as much the bar as it is the people the frequent it.  If you're looking for the ever so cliched hipster types, this is your place.  There are some bars that you walk into and instantly feel at home.  This isn't one of them unless you're a Kevin Rose lookalike.
author: Joshua W.

description:
I think what you need to know before heading to Casanova's for the first time is that it's a Mission dive bar with a lot of hipster doofs inside.  The decor is strange, but fitting, and the music (whether they have a live DJ or just the juke box running) is always eclectic staying pretty much on the classic rock/obscure rock side.  On occassion Casanova will bring in a live band.

That all aside, I love the place.  I don't mind the hipster doofs, the decore, or the music.  The drinks are cheep and strong, comparitively speaking, and I really enjoy the large leather couches and the comfort level of this bar.  I can show up in my jeans and a t-shirt and not feel out of place or under dressed.  This a great bar to go to with friends to just drink and hang out.
author: lea m.

description:
Went to this place after as the second stop after an awesome super secret downtown location where you can go before and after the theater and isn't packed. I promised not to write a review about it, but it just might be the last hidden gem. (Actually, maybe I should yelp it to see how hidden it really is.)

Anyway, from wedding, to downtown to the mission, Casanova was the perfect last drink stop. Mandarin and soda, and one of the coolest atmosphere bars I have been to in the city. The decor is really beautiful, with the most interesting lamps. 

Also, even though it was late, and the bar was pretty full, we were still able to grab a table in the back and chat at an easy level. 

I have been here a few times before, and each time had a great time, so I think it deserves 5 stars...

Also, it is a great place to go after Limon, as it is right across the way.

-Seems on the weekdays there is much more of a local scene than the weekend.
author: Danielle V.

description:
Probably would be a three star place as they do make some stiff drinks that are decently priced BUT they put a lime in my 7/7 who does that? I will tell you who, hipsters. 

ALSO Blondies Bar is next door so when that gets busy, the people from that bar come ruin Casanova. 

The Hipsters make me hate this bar, in terms of decor and and layout its pretty cool but people try to hard there.
author: Allan R.

description:
3 1/2 stars. 

I don't visit this Mission haunt often. It gets too crowded even in the early evening hours. And I don't care for crowds in general. Unless it's crowds of those grape lights that illuminate the bar area with a low but shiny glow that fascinates my eye before but especially after a couple martinis. So, if in the area, I drop in not long after this minimalist bar and lounge opens. There are fewer naked lady pictures on the walls than when I first wandered in but the bar seating and back space has been filled in nicely. I still don't know what the restrooms are like but after a recent review of mine, that may be A Good Thing. Over the years, the bartenders have always been sincerely friendly and always made the drinks the way I like 'em: both strong and tasty. Also, there's a variety of chat to be had here. Everything from local zaniness to global current events. Very laid-back and relaxing, again, in the couple hours just after opening.
author: Poet D.

description:
3.5 stars! After the Make Out Room and the Lone Palm, this is IT.

$3 Anchor Steam, a free jukebox, and dim lighting. This is what you come to the Mission for -- and Casanova is just the place to quench your most yearning Saturday night dive bar thirst. As for the "art" on the walls, I wasn't quite as mesmerized by the nude paintings as by the Bruce Lee body portrait (they WOULD). I plan on returning and snagging the couch next time!

An ideal drinking venue to start up your evening. (And maybe end it, too.) 

Yessir.
author: G. J.

description:
So I have two cousins that are going through divorces, so naturally I found myself out at a bar on a Sunday Night - wow me out on a Sunday night at a bar - I'm cool again!!!!

This place is really divey - i thought I was in the scene from Pretty in Pink when I walked into the bathroom and someone looking like Iona starting talking to me and all I heard was wanna hit???  

The music is really upbeat but still mellow for a Sunday night but louder then I wanted it to be.  The drinks are good but for someone that doesn't carry cash - yes they do have an ATM but I don't trust those things - didn't get to drink much!
author: May A.

description:
This is a small average lounge/bar by itself but I think it has a few very redeeming qualities:

- The bartenders are really friendly
- The place isn't generally so packed that you can't move
- Comfy couches in the back
- Lots of great nudity on the walls

In general, I like this place and find it to be a regular stop while bar hopping.
author: Ankur P.

description:
What other bar in town will let me pass out on the sofa after a hard night of drinking. Yes, I did sleep on the cough, but the vodka tonics made me! This is a great dive bar where you can spend a random Friday night. Plus, it's so dark you can roll in with your pajamas and no one will notice.

Just to add to the fun, try Sunday night karaoke. If you are lucky you may remember the night.. Doubtful.
author: Palak P.

description:
Shos's I shays to th' bartinder, I shays...  'ey Bartinder!  gimmuh a beeeer... whajjja got on tap *hic*...

Bartinder, nice blonde gal *hic* shlides over a taaall glash of heavinly liquid refffreshmint...  Shays "that'll be ttthhhree fifffty"...  I shays, "holy mollley, ttthrreee fiffty?!?  Whaaash ya poured me??"  And she shays... "Shierra Nevvvada..."

...At which point I immediated sobered up to the overpowering revelation that this classically divey tavern in the "hipster" Mission District represented excellent value for the entertainment dollar.  Eclectically dressed denizens of the neighborhood, along with a loose and uncomfortable-looking assortment of Marina imports, crowd the small but wide space and luxuriate on the couches, while a DJ serenades the room with "rockin'" beats.  And the decor (elegrant reproductions of tastefully trashy nudes) puts the punctuation on this wonderful bar.

...pluuussh, th' drinksh are cheeaaap...
author: Chuck W.

description:
There is carpet. In a bar. It grosses me out. 

And it reminds me of the rec room at my best friend from middle-school's  grandparent's farm.
author: Eli B.

description:
my friend took me here yesterday, and I really dug it. The floorplan is nice and open, and there are too -good -to -be true, super cheesy nude female paintings that are highlighted amongst the dark walls. The jukebox features an offbeat selection of rock, punk, classic country, rockabilly, traditional and non-traditional mexican music (it is the mission, after all). Check out the giant glass grapes hanging over the bar! too cool. The bartender was really friendly, and happy hour (4-7pm) drinks are a deal. I understand there is a rotating selection of dj's, too, which will be worth the trip back.

my personal experience was highlighted by a run in with 2 lookalike cousins from the neighborhood. They were super hammered and funny as fuck. Going into a bar in the late afternoon is becoming a favorite ritual of mine while hanging out in sf for the day. Casa Nova's was a perfect addition to another interesting san francisco day.
author: Caddy M.

description:
So I forgot my skinny jeans, plaid shirt, and Buddy Holly glasses, but I still had a good time in this quasi-hipster hangout. It was a great place to catch up with a friend I hadn't seen in a few years and the DJ was playing some really sweet cuban/funk/dance stuff.

Big comfortable couches to just chill and enjoy a drink, although I had to watch the couple right next to us make out like it was junior high all night. I think the combo of red candle light and paintings of naked ladies on the walls must have set the mood just right, plus I guess it's excusable given the place's name.
author: C P.

description:
this used to be my home away from home....  

It still serves the most generous pour of Jameson for the cheapest price in town... and most of the bartenders are still friendly....

but I don't know what happened.... maybe I outgrew it?  maybe it started getting too crowded?  Maybe i decided I needed a bar activity(pool, etc.)?  Maybe i'm still holding a grudge because they abruptly cancelled my dj night after 2 years?  Maybe the constant barrage of homeless people out front jsut wore me down? I dunno...

I still love you, casanova, but we needed some space....
author: kevin w.

description: This spot has a very cool vibe to it- pretty eccentric crowd, unique decor, and I love how they have couches in the back in case you want to get your groove on late into the night. :)  Diverse selection of music, but just go and check it out for yourself. Typical Mission spot, but somehow better than most.
author: Christina V.

description: My first time in here was this past Bastille and it was a rock'n!  All 60's all French all on vinyl.  Sergio had a dance party in that tiny sofa area.  My sensors were on overload.  The place is decorated in the style of 60's cheesiness.  Its amazing!  Great bar staff that are down to share a laugh.  I will definatley be hitting this place up more often!  It's brilliant!
author: Mother L.

description:
By the time I get to this place on my Mission extravaganzas, it is always too crowded to move.  So maybe I should get to this place a little bit earlier.
The lighting and decor is great! Got to love naked lady paintings. There is also nice couch/table seating area towards the back. Can be hard to get  drink because of the crowds.
author: Katy D.

description:
Okay...so I have a love.hate with this place i guess i love it cause im here all the time. good stiff drinks. couches.

UPDATE:  Kristin, the bartender, is the best.
author: Katie Sue A.

description:
This was my first happy hour place in the city when I moved here in 2003.  They had $1.50 PBR's back then, and I'd get here right around 4:30 on Friday evenings and stay until around 7.  

Back then, the jukebox had stuff like Betty Davis, old old Alice Cooper, plus some weird international psychedelic comps, and they'd always have at least 10 credits sitting in there, waiting to be expended.

It gets very crowded at nighttime here, and it can be almost impossible to get a seat.  If that happens don't worry.  There's at least 2 dozen other bars within 4 blocks of this place that you can always head to instead.
author: Gopal R.

description:
I do like the couches, and the bartender was awesome. When we arrived she'd just made up an organic raspberry champagne martini thing on the fly for another customer and offered us some. HELL YEA! And it was delish. 

While we were getting slizzurped a man came in with a cooler full of empanadas. EMPANADAS! Chilean empanadas, to be exact.  e pulled the cooler from couch to couch, vending his fare. Now THAT is SERVICE. They were nice and warm and 3 bucks a piece. The crust was nice and buttery. Mm Mm Mm. 

Yea the couches are nice
author: Polly F.

description: I came here on friday night (1/14/11) with a group of friends, and all I can say is RUDE, RUDE, RUDE!!!!! I wish I got your name. There's no need to be rude to people, when they are asking what kind of wine you have. There's no need to be rude to people, when they have to scream to be heard (dont pull your head and body away as if I was screaming at YOU, I was screaming to be heard above the music and the other patrons). There's def no need to be rude to people when you dont carry the drink we order, when you offer an alternative, and when we dont agree to it. There's just no need.
author: Nghi Thu H.

description:
A sister bar to Hemlock, this place is pretty much the same as that place, except: (1) Hemlock has a better physical bar, especially the raised side; (2) no pool table at Casanova (anymore); (3) redder lights at Casanova; (4) better art at Casanova; (5) smoking "room" at Hemlock; (6) better "standing around" space at Hemlock (if you aren't at the bar, a table, or a sofa at Casanova, you feel like a buoy in the middle of the ocean); (7) weekend crowd better at Hemlock.

If I had my way, I'd rather be at Hemlock, but if I'm lazy, then I'm at Casanova.
author: David C.

description: Unfortunately I can no longer recommend this bar.  I accidently left my leather jacket on a barstool a couple of weeks ago and despite being the last person out of the bar when I called the next day they said they didn't have it in their lost & found.  Pretty clear that one of the bartenders or staff stole it.  Not impressed.
author: Ali B.

description: The sun isn't even down and it's Monday. Could the bartender be drunk already? I could have cleared the bar of customers in the time it took him to pour a pint. Aesthetically pleasing environment & cool music, though.
author: Laura T.

description: I liked the decor and the funny movie being projected onto the wall but the bartender looked kinda grumpy and both my friend and I thought our drinks were only so-so.  It wasn't bad, but nothing to write home about.
author: Mara H.

description:
Ehh... not amazing but not horrible either.  I think if I lived in SF, I'd probably kick it here often.  The DJ was really good and there were a decent amount of good looking fellas, but there were also a large amount of hipster chodey men trying to feel up on the women they are discretely trying to pass by to buy pretentious drinks at the bar (which is somewhat understaffed).

The drinks are strong and who could ever deny walls full of boooobs?  If I was bored and not in any mood to drink, I'd round up some of my alchy friends and come here just to scope out the greasy men and the lovely boobies.
author: Grace K.

description: Went to happy hour here.  The drinks were cheap, bar not crowded.  Pretty forgettable.
author: Marie B.

description:
I love dive bars-so anything that is dark, and divey already gets 3 stars in my book.  This place is no exception. Dark, dimly lit, red lighting that makes everyone look hot esp. after a few drinks; paintings of naked ladies on the walls (70s style), deep dark mismatched couches and coffee tables to sit and drink on, hip bartenders making strong drinks in which they don't tell you the name of?  

Gotta love it.
author: Denise B.

description: This place is pretensiously unpretensious. It has kind of a hipster crowd and no real feel to the place. Im sure if you come with a group of your own friends its probably a good time, but a social/singles bar it is not. I give it a plus for the cheesy decor, strong drinks, big comfy couches. it get no stars for lack of drink selection, cash only policy, music, and overall whateverness...
author: Lehasa M.

description:
Went to Casanova's for the first time 2 weeks ago on a Thursday nite... it was fun but nothing really stood out, maybe cuz it was a weeknite? I love the erotic art, though... more please! 

I've heard good things about Casanova's so I'll be back to check it out on a weekend...
author: Nenette Y.

description:
Like boobs?

This is the place for you then as most all the paintings on the walls have the women in them hanging their unmentionables out for all to see, but not to worry, it's far from seedy! Really they are more fun vintage paintings in a 70s type style that I'd be proud to hang on my wall and which really help to set an ambiance for the joint. Vintage hanging lamps on chains and red mood lighting set to the back beat of a well stocked juke box that's not so loud that you are hoarse from trying to talk to your pals at the end of the night. 

All that combined with a couple of finely mixed drinks will help to complete a memorable evening for everyone in your party. 

With all the pretentious wanna be LA night spots opening in San Francisco (have jeans, tennis shoes, trucker cap NO SERVICE) it's great to find another local waterhole that prides itself on it's guest having an enjoyable time rather than being background characters for marketing a scene.
author: Geoff W.

description: loved the margaritas and the atmosphere is dark loungish (in a good way) with a retro flair... go drink, have fun, meet up with people and meet people... Also a good spot to have a drink while waiting for your reservations at places nearby. I look forward to chatting up with a drink and my friends... good fun
author: Jennifer H.

description: Um..I don't get it. This place is hideous, even for a mission bar. It's a complete hole in the wall..in the ugly, not cool, way. It looks like they threw some red paint on the walls in hopes that it would detract from the rest of the place but that didn't work. It's like putting a bow on a bulldog, you can try to cute'in it up with the bow but the second you look down at it's face you realize it's still an ugly motherf*cker.
author: Shreya C.

description: Really cool place. But does get really packed often and the bar jets out and squeezes a bottleneck right by the door. Couches, cool paintings. This is a cool spot to meet someone ie. Not just locals/groups so you got a shot. May have to fight to get to the bar during the busy times, same everywhere. But its a really great place
author: Christopher F.

description:
I don't understand how a dive like this only offers one light beer. Meh. And despite enjoying the chance to catch-up with friends, didn't enjoy having to yell at one another over the way too loud angry rock/slightly metal soundtrack. My ears hurt afterwards, which says a lot coming from someone who has no problem dancing next to speakers blaring house and trance for hours. Double meh.

Elixir, Kilowatt and Gestalt all do it much, much better.
author: Jason B.

description:
No trip to the Mission would be complete without a trip to the Casanova.  This place is chill.  The drinks are strong and cheap, there is a good selection of beer on tap, and the crowd is young and hip but not snooty.

There are nude paintings all over the walls, but its pretty dark in there, so its not that distracting/offensive/gross.
author: Katie S.

description:
11:54. I just got back from my new favorite spot! As Casanovas name has historically remained synonymous with seduction its no surprise I felt like the worlds greatest lover upon entering Casanova!  
The dark androgynous setting and pictures really made me feel sexy.  I just hope I didn't do anything I'm gonna regret hearing about tomorrow..this is one bar i don't want to burn bridges with..LOVED LOUNGING AT CASANOVA

"I am writing My Life to laugh at myself, and I am succeeding." Giacomo Casanova
author: Kyle B.

description: This is a great little bar. We went on our last night in SF. My husband and I went to visit a friend of his who bartends there and we ended up having fun and getting a little tipsy. Would def go back again.
author: Hillary R.

description: I hate the decor inside the bar but the bartender makes a strong jack and coke. The people here were really weird though. I remember there were a couple of girls sitting at the bar writing in their notebooks on a Saturday night.
author: John E.

description:
Couldn't agree with you more, Kayla. 

Don't go here.

So bad we took just a few sips of our drinks and then handed them off to some girls near the exit as we were making our way the hell out of there.
author: Leslie N.

description:
Naked. Lady. Paintings. 
I'm particularly a fan of the voluptuous redhead. 
This place is so tacky it's classy. 
Mondays and Tuesdays are best if you actually want to hear yourself think.
author: D H.

description: Stiff drinks, low prices, and nekked ladies on the wall.  What's not to love?
author: Polly Prissypants ..

description: One of these days, I want to be immortalized on velvet.  Nude.  With a giant 'fro and ankh.  I'm just freaky that way.  This bar stinks sometimes, literally, but it's decent enough and I get off on their collection of fine velvet portraiture.
author: Kate M.

description:
This place is one of the few considered spacious enough to contain the hordes of people that descend upon Mission on Friday and Saturday nights.

But personally I prefer it on weekdays when all is calm but with kicking music and stiff drinks.  Great for a meet-up place!

Definitely snag the stage seating all the way in the back and peer out on the mayhem that ensues if it's a weekend!
author: Femita J.

description:
Abgefahrene Bar. Von aussen versifft, von innen hui.
Man kommt einfach ins Gespraech mit den Leuten.
author: Johannes B.

description:
3.17.2007
5:00PM

I come here often: mainly because my roomate likes this joint...but I must admit, it's definately growing on me.  The last time I came here, it was a sunny St. Patrick's Day afternoon, on a mission in The Mission to get sufficiently drunk before the Bloc Party concerto.  

4 drinks later, I'm ready to step out of this vintage victorian-inspired dive back into the streets....within the hour.  To all the lame asses that went to North Beach/downtown/Marina for St. Patty's day, HA HA HA HA.  Hope you enjoyed the long waits, disgusting green beer, and DJs throwing down the new Timberlake jam.

I'm definately coming back.
author: William R.

description:
Cool bar.  I first went a couple of weeks ago on a Thursday night with a friend and enjoyed the hell out of it.  It is just a great Mission dive bar.  And as everybody says you can't miss the boobs.  They are everywhere in the back.

Also you can't go wrong with a bar that serves Hoegaarden, great beer.  Reminds me of my time in Belgium...but I digress.  It's a great hang out bar that you can find a couch with your friends, chill, drink and enjoy everything the mission has to offer.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Exiting EOS I get a ring on my phone. It's Ian! He's where? In the Mission (where i live). Haha I am in the Haight (where he lives), but I'll come back to the Mission and meet for a drink. Where? he asks. 

Casanova of course! 

I love this place. For years the Casanova has been my 'starter' bar. I can always count on it to provide me with a good start to my evening. The crowd is pretty mixed age wise. But more than that I keep going back 'cause maybe 'this time' I'll have the guts to steal a set of those grape lights or that velvet Burt Reynolds picture. Rad.

This night though I picked it because I was pretty sure I would not run in to my ex-boyfriend there. He hates that place. Thank god 'cause I hate dividing up the Mission. I mean really it should be all mine. Oh, I guess I really shouldn't be writing that. Continuing on..

Pros: Good strong drinks, good selection of beer, great dj, the type of light that makes everyone look good..dark, I guess lot of boob shots (if you are into that stuff), and ex boyfriend free

Cons: Not the best kept girls bathroom, full of ex-boyfriend's friends (what? grrr)

Pros: lots of hugs from ex's friends and nice things said...five stars just for that. 

See you can always count on the Casanova!
author: Zoe s.

description:
Velvet paintings of naked chicks.  It makes me feel like I'm in Dick Hallorann's hotel room in The Shining.  Totally awesome.

Drinks are good too.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Hand's down my favorite bar in San Francisco with special kudos to Don, Raquel, Valerie, Andrew, Campezi, Margarita and Alex though the bar staff is generally right on here.

To be fair, I most often I avoid The Casanova on the weekend nights as I do most bars, clubs and restaurants in the city.   Weekends are made for making dinner with friends at home or getting the hell out of dodge.  In general (and if possible) I prefer to avoid the weekend warrior types, tourists and Marina assholes "slumming" in the Mission.

As it is said, "Timing is everything".
author: annie s.

description:
A local, half-step-above divey hangout with comfy leather couches and a smelly women's bathroom even at 4:30pm.

I like coming to chill with friends before it gets too crowded.  Overall, a good but not essential stop on a Mission crawl.
author: michelle s.

description:
JAGUAR RIDE 
3rd Sunday of the Month
Best DJ NIght Ive been to in a really long time; and I'm a DJ (SUCKERPUNCH Mondays at the Transfer) 
Bob Simons and Los Ole are the most original DJs in town.
They play awesome 77' Punk, Glam Wave, Glitter Rock, and other great stuff. 
THIS IS NOT A SOUL/OLDIES NIGHT (THANK GOD) 
It is a funsplosion of music you dont hear anyone play.
So if youre tired of the same soul/hip hop/dance whatever night at whatever club come check out
JAGUAR RIDE!!!
ALWAYS FREE
CHEAP DRINKS
JAMS
BABES & DUDES!!!
author: Ryan P.

description:
The few times I have been here always start out great and end in pain. I am not sure if I can thank the bartender for strong drinks or the Dave Navarro look alike for the roofie. 

In agreeance with the crowd, the lighting in this place is sizzling hot and sexy. It somehow makes the men look better without the beer goggles and I tell you, I like it. It can get really busy here, but the DJs usually flood the place with crowd pleasing mixed music and the ambiance is pretty good. 

If I hadn't made a complete fool out of myself the last time I was here, I would def go back again. Take note, they don't like it when you get drunk and throw up in their sofas.
author: Ashley s.

description:
Another favorite bar in the city. Total hipster "scene" bar, so it seems like its easy to predict what you're going to get. Cool atmosphere, there are sometimes a few fixed-gear bikes parked along the wall inside and some asian hipster chicks dancing like pulp-fiction devotees in the tile makeout room at the back. The resident DJs spin some really wicked old soul and vintage rock that you pretend to know the name of, just so you don't seem like a tool. The New Years Animal House toga party was probably the most fun I've had on that holiday.

+ for decor (velvet paintings rule)
+ for music (Dick Daaaale!)
+ for service and a
++ for the music! (James Brown!)
author: Alex C.

description:
Casanovas is a really great place for after work meet ups and post movie drinks. The decor is fabulous red and black paint meets velvet naked lady paintings from the 70's. They recently changed the back area into a more sitting room than bar atmosphere by adding vintage style couches and coffee tables all about. I definitely miss that pool table but agree that the sitting area vibe is all the rage these days. I enjoy the open space and airy feel along with the cheesy glass grapes hanging above the bar and the mustache clad djs spinning old skool jams. The cocktails are good and the bar staff are usually friendly.
I love hanging out after work during the week here but tend to avoid it on the weekends as it quickly becomes a hipster and bike fag hangout after 8pm on fridays. To many white belts and tight pants is always a sign to leave quickly.
author: Charlie B.

description:
Casanova was a 4, maybe even 5 star bar about 4 years ago. Now, I would give it only 3. There is something that's changed about this place. I used to live close to the Mission, and it was my favourite bar. It was perfect for what I call active socializing - talking to strangers, flirting with women and water it all down with copious amounts of Hoegaarden.

Now, it is still very busy. But the crowd has gone a little awry. It's a weird mixture of angry Mission locals (try living here, you'd be angry too), and out-of-town visitors. The locals normally congregate upfront  or at the tables far at the back, while the tourists and occasional visitors caucus in the middle, causing traffic jams and other fire hazards. 

The best place to position oneself is right at the semicircular bar, if you can get a seat there. Then you'd get adequate bartender's attention and, if you drink solo, you can rest assured that an attractive member of an opposite, contradictory gender will squeeze by your side to get a drink in no time. 

If you do venture out in the tables area, you will no doubt notice mildly erotic paintings of perfectly-buxom women, nude. They are good conversation starters, although they probably make many women feel self-conscious. 

On weeknights, this place is definitely more or a locals hangout, with loud indie-rock music (or is it classic rock? I am so out of date) spun by bartenders doubling as DJs. 

Make no mistake - Casanova is NOT a lounge by any means. Nor would I order any cocktails here apart from Jack and Coke. It is somewhat a dive, although relatively trendy one. Oh, and it has cool lanterns.
author: Evg R.

description:
The place it's kinda dark and the lighting makes the people look kinda scary, the couches in the back are sweet but they look dirty...maybe it's the lighting??

I was there last week with Trucker Hank, while Trucker Hank was busy talking to some guys @ the bar....again....I don't know he always talking to some total male stranger instead of girls....anyways..... 
I thought I knew 1 of the bartenders (the with pony tails) from a previous job so I went ahead and ask her and without hesitation she went and said NO!! later on I asked her again just to fuck with her and she said NO!! I'm a lesbian LOL!!! I told her I ain't into butch looking lesbian anyways, I stop ordering drinks from her I didn't want spit wit my beer.
author: Angelisimo G.

description:
In my opinion, this is the premier bar in the Mission. Granted there are some pretty rad bars that like to shred (e.g. The 500 Club). But this place has been pretty solid over the years. YES, it can get crowded, but how lucky are you when you manage to get a table? I know, it's a great feeling. There is Hooegarten here, there is Magner's, and that's all that really matters if you think about it. If Hooegarten and Magner's were to gain citizenship, and run on a joint ticket for the presidency, I would vote for them.....no joke.

About the bar itself, the place is dark, adorned with mexican style velvet puctures. There's a DJ on the weekends that cuts it up with some really good tunes. Don't let the restroom get you down. Learn to hold it, and break the seal when the line dies down.
author: M S.

description:
$1 off all beers for happy hour. This means I can get my beloved Fat Tire for $2.50 a pint.

Uh, hell to the yes.

Casanova is centrally located and near everything I love (food, Dolores Park, my house), so I'm a little biased. It's sort of a weird set up (think a big room with a tiny ass bar on the left side that curves slightly and doesn't go even the length of the room, random tables and couches in the back), but it's clean and has nekkid girl paintings (similiar to Annie's Social Club's). We sat at the bar yesterday in direct sunlight trickling in from Valencia, sipping on cold beer, and suddenly my life was so perfect. No joke.

Poetic, right?

P.S. Dear bartender lady in the pretty red dress last night, it was I who kept sneaking olives from the tray. I'm sorry. They looked so good in my drunken state.
author: Jenz y.

description:
This bar is fun when theres some place to sit. So the weekends are usually out, but its hard to find a good bar in the Mission on the weekend. Too many tourists I guess. 
I absolutely love the music in there though. 
And if you're lucky enough to get the spot on the stage, it looks like you're watching a bad reality tv show from there looking out into the bar.
author: Andrew B.

description:
I think this place might be coming back around. Every couple of years, everyone 'discovers' this place for a year or two and it's packed to the point of annoyance. But like clockwork, the hipsters all lose interest and migrate like moths to the next bright light (or else just go back to the 500 club as usual).

That said, this place may be on its way to becoming tolerable again soon.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Casanova is a place where normal schmos can feel like hipsters...just come in a pair of jeans and you'll feel yourself blend in with the hip, young crowd.  

Casanova is a cool neighborhood bar where everyone seems friendly.  The nudes on the walls could make for a good opening line, might even become a lively topic of conversation, and who knows what else.  

Check it out!
author: Ashok P.

description:
You know what? I want to like this place, I really do. But I just can't get behind a place where, despite the amazing music being played, NOBODY DANCES. I know that dancing isn't in the "hipster credo" or whatever, but man... at least show some kind of interest and love for the DJ. I can't listen to soul music without dancing.. and it's way too loud in there to do any talking! 

So hipsters of Valencia St, I implore you.. DANCE! You may actually smile.
author: Allison C.

description:
Cold, loud, uncomfortable place. 

I'm shocked at all the Yelp reviews. Is lame is the new cool?
author: Ms K.

description:
We met some really cool people the first time we went to Casanova, and as I'm almost 5 months new to the city, it's refreshing to meet some kickass normal blokes with great taste in music and humor. I've been here most weekends, haven't had the chance to go during the week yet, but I bet it's just as good.

Had some crazy SF initiation shot, tasted like a cross between yager & goldschlager (sp?) and had a pretty knarly aftertaste. The night proceeded to go downhill from there, ending in an african drum circle at an undisclosed location...

Conclusion: one of my faves in san francisco.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I really like coming to Casanova on say... a Tuesday. Weekends are awful, way way too crowded... But isnt every bar on 16th and Valencia disgustingly packed on the weekends? yes. lame. 

minus one star for sucking on weekends
minus one star because the bartender there didnt like me for a while
plus one star because he eventually forgot why he didnt like me

and i found twenty dollars on the floor there one time.
author: Sarah B.

description:
What's not to like about velvet paintings of naked women?

Oh and the vibe and drinks are keen as well.
author: Eric T.

description:
I used to really like this place, but now my opinion can pretty much be summed up by this story:

The last time I was here, about 2 months ago, I had to resort to PHYSICALLY ASSAULTING a dude to get him away from me because he wouldn't stop touching me and saying very raunchy things. I told the doorman what happened and apparently it wasn't a big deal; he did jack shit about it. I understand that you can't help who comes to the bar, but I had witnesses and even random strangers helped me out. Why couldn't the STAFF have done something about it? 

I still see that guy around the mission, and every time I do I fight the urge to light his stupid  triangle chin beard on fire.

I miss the old days when I used to actually enjoy having a drink and a dance here.  Maybe I'll come back when I see that douchebag on the next episode of To Catch a Predator. Until then, Casanova, you are not my idea of a good time.
author: Jb O.

description: Bar-hopping the Lower Mission has always come easily, but for some reason the Upper Mission is thornier--the crowds a bit crowdier, the sidewalks a bit sketchier.  Casanova, however, is a pure throwback to the hipster love of the 20's (the street blocks, that is, not the decade), with its low-red lighting, sensuous paintings and couches inviting you in to stay a while.  Those who want to sip high-quality drinks in (relative) refinement will still prefer Elixir, but if you want to dive in to the 16th St scene, Casanova is the place to start.
author: Wes M.

description: There's a full bar. The girl to guy ratio is 2-to-1.  And boobs are painted and framed on all the walls. A straight guy's 5-star heaven. A cool, drop in Mission bar for me.
author: Alex H.

description: well shit.  I was staying in a hostel in North Beach on Halloween eve decided North Beach was not our scene and it was my duty to drag some foreigners out and find a decent bar.  I phoned a friend from the local moped gang and was told go to mission, get off the BART and walk left. We did and found this place, love.  Cheap AND good drinks which came up wicked quick considering how busy it was, they had a killer DJ playing vinyl who when asked for more dance music said "This older stuff is all i got" and when I asked "Any Dead Kennedys for me and my hot Swiss friend?" He said "Yeah man!" I love it and want to go back sober earlier in the evening.
author: Jon W.

description: Strong drinks, Velvet paitings, good music and comfy couches. The best dark, devious debauchery you can get. There's sure to be lots of shenanigans at this casa. Phonogram is the only way to get me out on a Friday night. Yes it's crowded and yes you'll have to go outside to cool off. But it's a hot time.
author: Marianne s.

description: Its always a great bar to go with friends. Its typical laid back, great music mission bar. it gets busy and there are times when you need to wait to be able to order your drinks. If you go there any other day than Thursday-Sat, then its easy to get a seat and get drinks as soon as you go to the bar.
author: Sheyla A.

description: Not the best bar in the mission but the drinks are strong and the atmostphere is chill.  It's a bit on the cheesy side complete with person selling rose, cigarettes, and candy bars. It's definately the hipster bar scene.
author: Marissa P.

description: Not a bad dive.  Love the glass grapes hanging over the bar.  Crowd was young and a little poser.  Dude had a pair of pants on that were girl tight and barely covering his business.  Could have been a poser hipster ken doll - not sure, but thanks for the bad visual.  Drinks good when you can get one.  Good for one drink then quickly bale to a bar you really want to hang out in.
author: Doreen D.

description:
some nights this place is tolerable.
some nights this place is great.
some nights there are illegal activities in the bathrooms.
some nights people are cool and will share their couches with you.
some nights there are douches who come down from the marina to slum it with us old timers.
some nights there are some really good looking mishy peeps.

and every night there are strong well drinks and margaritas that will knock you on your ass.
author: May T.

description: I was just there again this last Sunday.  I remember walking in, but I don't remember walking out.  Nonetheless, I woke up the next morning unmolested in my own bed - so I'm going to go with a fiver.
author: Joe C.

description: Well what can I say....I love the Mission. You're likely to find me here. Chill place, plus I love the erotica on the wall....cheap drinks. Woot Woot.
author: Stephanie M.

description: cheap drinks, odd decor, usually not insanely crowded.
author: Michael E.

description:
DON'T GO HERE! Unless you like pretentious bartenders and bouncers. My group of friends didn't leave right when they said to leave at 1:45, we were finishing out beers, so they decided to come over and yell at everyone saying we were being disrespectful for not leaving right when they said to. The bouncer then proceeded to threaten a friend saying "I will kill you". 

All the bartenders are so stuck up about their jobs, they just serve $2.50 PBRs to hipsters, they need to get over themselves.

I would not recommend this place to anyone, they clearly don't know how to treat paying customers. There are plenty of other bars in the mission that at least know how to deal with their patrons
author: Greg D.

description: As my weight fluctuates I like to go to Casanova purely to compare myself to the physiques of the lovely ladies on the wall.  Drinks are strong enough to get a little girl like me drunk quick.  The DJ's during the week are really cool.  And if you are looking for a mellow spot and guaranteed couch space check this place out on a Mon-Wed.
author: Justine D.

description:
The last Wednesday of the month here is epic!
DJ Sergio spins French pop from the 60's and 70's with accompanying old French flicks and it's rad! I LOVE French pop! Especially the oldies! This particular choice in tunes went especially well with Casanova's spacious and super loungey interior. It's dim and romantic lighting, coupled with the comfy couches made me bat my eyelashes flirtatiously at my companion, Natalie, before I remembered she's my BFF, we've gone there and back and we're just friends lol. So I turned my mega-watt smile on Will but he only responded by buying me a white wine spritzer. Damnit! Oh but the spritzer was yummy and quite refreshing and who doesn't love making a bartender happy by ordering something so different and yet terribly 80's vintage? Spritzers are the new pirates! Ahem. I only had one but it's apparently STILL going straight to my head. Bottom line is that this spot is great for kicking back, drinking a tasty beverage and listening to some cool tunes with cool people.
author: Jill D.

description: After dinner in the MIssion District on our recent trip to SF we walked by Casanova Lounge and decided to stop in for a drink. A cute DJ in a poka dot dress was spinning good underground  rock-n-roll music while old movies were projected  on the wall. Bartenders were buff tattooed chicks that were really efficient. This place had an awesome vibe! Loved it!!
author: G S.

description: So there I was, just turned 21 and in San Francisco for the first time.  On some advice from a co-worker, we decided to travel to the Mission for some good bars and heavy drinking.  This bar was the first place we stumbled upon.  First impressions were chill environment and great place to have a drink.  The DJ was playing non top 40 oldies and I sat at the bar all night with constant service.  Personally I find this place to be either a good jump off point or last call resolution.  Good crowd, but not the place to get real crazy.
author: Mike D.

description: While looking for a cheap bar in the Mission district, Mike and I checked this place out- the prices were decent, and the drinks were strong. The art on the walls is on the provocative side and it's dark and loud. It was so loud that Mike and I had to yell at each other to talk- this was the loudest lounge I've ever been to.
author: Mel C.

description:
not really sure why this place always seems so crowded... but then again most bars in the mission get pretty filled...
came here for a friend's birthday party but ended up leaving pretty early since it was so crowded...
author: charlotte s.

description:
Before going to Blondie's my friend and I went here for a quick drink. For a Saturday, the place is not hopping like the other places in the Mission. 

I have been to a lot of bars but I am not sure if I would like to go back to this place. The place does not give me a good feeling and for some, they might not care but I do. 

In addition, the music is too loud for the time and day. It's 7pm and it's not even 11pm and the music is a loud for conversation. If only, the DJ would adjust the volume and know when to play loud so people does not have to yell or talk loud just to converse with friends. 

I give them credit for having happy hour from 4-7pm! I think the beers are $1.00 during happy hour.

There is a parking garage around the corner and limited street parking. Make sure to bring a lot of change for parking meters. Parking meters run until 6pm and $0.25 for every 3 minutes.
author: Lileth M.

description: Came here on a weeknight with a friend. The drinks were good, but what is most memorable -- as everyone mentions in their reviews too -- are the velvet paintings of nude women. Don't worry, they're tasteful.
author: Tamara M.

description: Hottest bar ever!!  Just don't go there on a friday or Saturday night, as it turns super Marin-0-whore.  wait till a nice, slow, weekday, and experience the true Cassanova.  But don't get me too drunk or I'll end up in bed with the bartender (or 2 of them, or 3).  hhhmmmm....neck tats.
author: Pammy S.

description:
don't ask why it took me over ten years of living here to go to this bar. i think i'd been to just about every other bar in the mission with the exception of this one. maybe it was something about the sign, which i like, but it's possible it gave me a weird feeling. i don't really know. 

anyway, i finally ventured into this place a couple months ago and now it's one of my favorite bars in the mission. first off, it's dark, but not too dark, and noisy, but not noisy enuf to make you woozy from the combination of alcohol and yelling to be heard. they play good music, and the people are a mix. plus i like that it feels vaguely pink in there. 
the drinks are stong enuf and average priced. and it isn't too smelly. don't be like me and wait 10 years. or do, cause i don't want it to get any more crowded than it is.
author: rachel p.

description: Dark, little dive bar in the Mission area. I always find it strange when places only takes cash, but a BAR??? The atmosphere was ok and the drinks were decent. I wished they had darts, a pool table or board games.
author: Gladys C.

description:
I went here once with my sweetie and a couple of friends after a gut-busting tapas dinner at Ramblas a couple of doors down, and well, it was alright. I liked that they had a decent beer selection (yes, I'm a beer snob) because it seems like an SF bar with a decent beer selection is a rare commodity.(if you think having Sierra and Fat Tire as the best things on tap equals a good beer selection, don't even talk to me, k?)
So we had a good time having a couple drinks there, but the thing that irked me the most about this joint was that the music was REALLY FRACKIN LOUD. It was a Sunday night, and NO ONE was dancing. Turn it down for chrissakes. Maybe I'm getting old, but why would a bar want to make it impossible to have a conversation without going hoarse? How the hell is anyone supposed to mack on each other, or chill and have a good time with friends, when they cannot communicate without hand signals?
author: Melissa L.

description: A solid mission standby with good drinks and a lively atmosphere.
author: Nathan L.

description: OK i made friends with the DJ and bartender and  I had a time of  my life. Do your bartender right and you will love Casanova. Plus the DJ was just pure fun!!!!
author: Brandi R.

description: One of my favorite hipster bars. It's huge & has sexy lighting. The couches are perfect for pbr fueled make out sessions. Bartenders are a little distracted and aloof, but that's okay.
author: Maria D.

description: Only gets 3 stars because it is only good for happy hour.  If I wasn't a recovering alcoholic, it would still be my favorite happy hour location.
author: Liz E.

description: Great bar.  Lots of fun.  It's the best of the best so far as SF dive bars are concerned.  Friendly people, and fantastic bartenders.  (And they pour STRONG drinks, too!)  This place possible has the best (ONLY!?) good DJs in San Francisco.  If I had one complaint, it's that they don't take credit cards.  If I had two complaints, the other is that the weekend crowds have been far more of the "look at me" type, than just cool people who are fun to talk to, but that's only happened recently...I'm sure those people will find some other bar to go ruin soon enough!
author: Kevin H.

description: It's a hole and it smells bad...however it is red  carpeted and had 12 pictures of boobs which is nice...very classy !  It's a hipster pickup spot...16th Valencia ...you know the drill... There was lots of single women there...I just couldn't stomach them though...Prolly not where you'll meet "the one"
author: Daniel Q.

description:
my girlfriend and i love to come here early when it's not so crowded. we would grab one of the funky couches, drink some inexpensive martinis and ask each other, "how was your day?" the conversation often leads to some relaxing head, neck and shoulders massage. we can almost hear the nude women on the wall applauding such tlc and encouraging us to get down. well, we can't disappoint them. so we make out and make out some more on the couch. all good stuff. it never fails. i personally think that the nude women on the wall are like soft porn. perhaps that's why we get so horny whenever we're here.

i also like to add that the music is good here. the right music can make all the difference during a public makeout session.
author: frisco j.

description: Comfy couches scattered through the the joint backed by some pretty cool art lining the walls. The layout is set up perfect for some sort of performance on the stage-like alcove, but it's just another couch.
author: Dennis C.

description: I love the seatings arrangement! Very comfortable. The drinks are not too bad and grinding my ass on another yelper's crotch while sipping gin and tonic isn't half bad either. The crowd is good and lots of eye candies to stare at.
author: Perry S.

description: Easily missed among the plethora of bars and restaurants along the Valencia Street corridor, Casanova Lounge features comfy couches and perfect mood lighting, with a fairly mixed crowd during the week.  This one I wouldn't mind coming back to.  The nude female paintings are an interesting touch to the decor.  For that, I'd give it four stars if I were a straight man (or a lesbian).  Otherwise, I'll stick with three.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Velvet paintings of naked ladies on the walls and glowing grape hanging from the ceiling.  Couches to lounge on.  It's a good place to start the night out.  Your milling around the mission and can't decide what to do.  Great fake out dive bar.  Drinks are mildly strong, bartenders are cool.  They have a DJ on most nights.
author: amanda v.

description: i heart casanova. One of the few bars where the bartenders get as trashed as you. And they talk back to you. sweet.
author: Annie T.

description: I was not familiar with truly divey dive bars.  Two weeks ago, I decided to test the waters.  Casanova in the Mission was recommended to me.  Not my scene AT ALL.  Maybe, just maybe if I were drunk off my corporate ass.  And maybe if I brushed up on the history of socialism.  To each her own!
author: Lily T.

description: I will admit that the margs are good and it is in the Mission BUT this bar is generally pretty LAME!!! It is the type of place where boys push girls and the crowd just sort of sucks. Go when it isn't too busy, drink a marg, and avoid on Fri and Sat nights.
author: Roxane S.

description: Casanova Lounge is one of those grungy and fun bars in the Mission that's perfect to hang out in any night of the week. Excellent beer selection, jukebox and a very eclectic crowd. A pool table and couches round off the atmosphere in this great chill bar. And we've decided that the decor looks like the inside of a prostitutes coffin.
author: Michael E.

description:
Wow. The male bartender that works here is an ASSHOLE!!! I have never been so insulted by someone I'm giving good money for booze to! 

We left the bar after the bartender insinuated something to the effect that my friend and I might not be planning to pay for our drinks. This was based on the fact that my friend got up to use the bathroom after she ordered. The bartender screamed at me to go get my friend out of the bathroom to pay for her drink. I thought he was kidding at first. Then I realized he was actually being serious. What a psycho. She came back and asked for her drink. He made some more snide comments to the effect of "You want a new drink or the one I already poured for you?" I guess the bartender ended up thwarting our malicious female plans as we *did* end up paying for our drinks only to receive more assholic comments. I wanted to order something else but the bartender took the drink menu away from me and then proceeded to ignore me for the next 20 minutes (not that he was busy, no, just busy being a dickhole). 

We were so insulted that we didn't even finish our drinks and we won't be going back. Seriously a shame because the bar itself seemed pretty cool (good decor, decent vibe if a bit snooty, dimly lit, my kinda thing for sure) and the other female bartender wasn't particularly nice but definitely seemed okay (and way more mentally stable than mr. fuckhead). Ah well, if he hadn't been a jerk to us we probably would have stayed and given him another 10 bucks in tips or so, so I guess it's money well saved!

My advice: Go to this bar when he isn't working. Or after they fire him (we can only hope).
author: M J.

description: The Casanova is one of the very few bars I will actually agree to go to, but only on a weekday.  Before 8pm.  Who am I kidding, I hate bars.  But the happy hour here makes the beer on tap pretty cheap, and it's literally down the street from my house.  So if I feel like drinking beer in a place that isn't my living room or kitchen, I'll go here.  I guess.
author: Mike A.

description: cute place. gets pretty crowded on a thursday night but my friend and i managed to find a table. sweet! drinks are cheap. good place to get the party started.
author: Linda N.
