description: Nice decor, and cool people. The drinks I got were VERY weak (but hey, maybe that was a fluke), and It's loud, but you can't beat that location.
author: Anonymous A.

description: I wonder if anybody would frequent this joint if it weren't located @ the prime 16th-Valencia intersect. Adorned with scantily clad ladies out of the 1970's, this Burt Reynolds shrine is a grimy neighborhood dive. Still, the vibe is chill, the 'tenders friendly, and the Missionites can be flirty.
author: dave y.

description: A-OK in my book.  What's not to like, decently priced drinks, naked velvet women on the walls, and pretty quick service.  Does the trick.
author: Kristine C.

description: Good local yokal place for hanging any night of the week...gets a little packed on Fri. & Sat. I like it as my standard dive Mission bar...Much better than the yuppie wanna be cool mission type Blondies crowd. Too many B&Ters there for my blood so the "Nova's" a chiller stomping ground. A bit on the scrungy side but still a good spot. To boot there are generally more males than females and that's always a positive for us straight single gals...
author: Samira S.

description: I love the velvet paintings - man there are some good looking boobies up on those walls.  This is def one of the bars on my short list, the bartenders are great and prices are good.  It's not quite my crowd but I've been able to make a good time of it on several occasions.
author: EVA G.

description: Perhaps if I had a trust fund and a groovy, ill-fitting sportcoat, I would enjoy this place more, but I know I wouldn't. Never have so many people worked so hard to look like they don't give a shit (yes, indeed, that is irony, but no, it is not delicious). Fuck the beer selection, that's the same a saying you liked the way a movie was shot. You want it to be good, but if it was, you wouldn't be thinking of that shit in the first place.
author: Big S.

description: This place is rad. The music was good, drinks fairly strong, but best of all they projected Gem and the Holograms on the wall.....yes!!
author: Crystal S.

description: I think I've been to the Casanova 5 nights in the past week.. but I guess that says more about me than anything else! They have Racer 5 on tap and there is some dude who DJs frequently that always plays the same songs, which is crappy except they are always my favorite songs. You can probably find me lurking on the stage thing in the very back watching people try to decide which side is the appropriate bathroom for their gender, and they're always wrong. Hahaha, I love you, Casanova. I cant deal on the weekends, but the Casanova's better for lurking weeknights anyway.
author: katharine s.

description: I don't frequent straight bars too often... since a lot of them are often either nasty or boring. Casanova definitely is an exception: I've always had a good time there. The place has somewhat of a divey feel (but then again it's in the Mission), but it's really not bad and it's a good place to enjoy a few drinks and relax with some friends. The decor inside is pretty cool: I love all the cool lamps over the bar, the red lighting, the couches and painting. It gets super crowded on weekends, so don't expect to be able to sit, but it's not bad at all on weekdays. Cool crowd and cool atmosphere, I've always had a good time there.
author: David S.

description:
Five stars for the fact they served drinks juuuuuust after "closing time" (when most bartenders would be jerks and deny you) and then they were cool enough to turn up the juke box really loud and let us enjoy the last couple gasps of Lionel Richie's "All Night Long" while we pounded down those precious pints of PBR and some jagermeister chasers.

Now that's what I call service!
author: Alex G.

description:
cassanova is a fun dive bar in the heart of the mission that gets pretty crowded on weekends. sadly, after fernet shots and a bunch of vodka sodas, the other details about this place are deleted from my memory banks...

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com)
author: vlad k.

description: It has been quite awhile since I have been in to Casanova, and when I used to go more often it was usually a stop made later in the evening. So my memories are a little hazy. I was in the other night with a friend to grab a drink after we met for dinner and it was kind of cool to be there when things were so chill. I appreciate all the comfy couches to sit on and all the old school boob paintings.
author: J F.

description:
yeah i like the casanova, but not necessarily on the weekend. and yeah the  mixed drinks aren't the greatest.

on the other hand there is draft pbr and there is country and soul and just good stuff played by the dj's and you can actually talk to your friends cause it is not some awful dull roar of noise(or shitty house) like lots of places.

sorry there are hipsters who hang out there and you feel out of place in your blue button down...
author: Chris G.

description: I used to really love this place...and maybe I still will if I go during the week but it was terrible this past Friday night.  Crowded with bridge and tunnel crowd and all four of the 'bartenders' spent the majority of the time moving glassware back and forth instead of serving the throngs of people trying to order drinks--order a double so you won't need to go through that again.  And why a bar would decide to carpet their space is beyond me...it felt like I was walking on chewing gum.  Your feet sticking to the carpet every step.  Ewwwhhh.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Take a dive into
Grape lights and velvet paintings
The Mission's best bar
author: HaikuReview X.

description: My liver regrets the day I first went in there and ordered a Knob Creek neat.  Here I was all these years thinking that was a decent  bourbon. Then the bartender offered me a taste of Basil Hayden and I've never looked back and my liver has never forgiven me.  Thanks alot for being great bartenders who actually want patrons to have a good time and drink good liquor while destroying their livers!   And don't be like me, take the  advice of the bartenders who warned me not to go there on a Friday or Sat nights.
author: Natasha R.

description:
Love it here ! Naked girls on velvet paintings , good music , good vibes , not a meat market . dark lighting , cheap beer and "M" bartender is so awesome ! Love her ! 

Funny stuff happens here, fun fun fun  ! A smashing good time with friends
author: harry m.

description: I have gone to this place several times and I am finally getting around to posting on it. While it's never been a main event spot for me, it's a great place to lounge and chill before the main event or even a Sunday. The music is usually house mix to 80's R&B which is cool for me. Drinks are flowing for reasonable prices. They have some cool art on the wall if you want to step away from conversation and just browse for a minute. It has always provided a good atmosphere and a relaxed social environment. Definitely worth a look!
author: Stafford J.

description:
I happened to stumble upon this place when me and a friend were dropped off on 16th & Valencia as a suggested place to party. In all actuality, we were looking for the Knockout (which is on Mission between Valencia and 29th) but someone said it was way too far (I didn't know, I don't live here). But anyways, back to the review...
Cool little place. Walked in and it was loud and raucous with what looked like a lotta locals occupying the place. Pretty big place for a dive but still kinda packed, but not uncomfortably packed. Can't really say much for the drinks cuz all I got was a pint of Pyramid. The decor was nice and sleazy and the bathrooms were just your typical dive bathroom adorned with Sharpie graffiti, song lyrics, profanities and random numbers. The music, from what I saw, was blaring from the jukebox. What I heard was a nice mix of old school punk rock tunes and classic indie jams. Nothing too scary, though. Nice little place to hang out though. Definitely not a bad time. I'll surely be coming back when I come back up to SF.
author: Anthony T.

description:
great bar. drinks are cheap and the bartenders are always very nice. the djs have been really good when i've been there, although i have gone there once or twice and found the music unbearable (if i was cooler i would know how to categorize what i heard, but i just know it was annoying, "electronic" sounding and loud), but this was one or two times out of a hundred so i'm not holding it against them. 

it can get really crowded on the weekends but during the week you can always find a comfy couch to lounge in.  and it's definitely a "hipster" scene, but isn't most of san francisco anyway?
author: Sam S.

description: $2.50 PBR's - cool bar staff. Decent crowd. My only criticism is the music is alright but doesn't follow any pattern of trajectory. The tunes are rolling out like an almost bad request show. That said, I came in two nights in a row so I find it fun. Drink up Johnnie!
author: Scott K.

description:
i don't remember.
that probably means something good.

(photos from last weekend indicate that yes, something good was going on in here.)
author: Irene S.

description: Despite my lack of neighborhood street cred, I always manage to have a fun time when I come to Casnova. As others have noted, there's a good beer selection, and the jukebox is pretty decent as far as bar jukeboxes go. The crowd is pretty diverse, but you can fit in even if, God forbid, you happen to live north of Geary.
author: Chris B.

description: Spent my 22nd birthday here, and what I remember of the evening was great.  PBR on tap, cheap, and when for whatever reason we decided smoking a bowl in the back was a good idea, no one seemed to notice.  Went back another night and had just as much of a good time, even though it was more crowded.  Same cheap drinks, and a great DJ.  It's dark, and slightly skeevy looking so you know, full of hipsters ;)
author: Catherine K.

description:
great decor and a very welcoming atmosphere. you walk in and have the bar tower over everything else, which doesn't happen often.

plenty of space to sit and talk, or walk and talk, and the crowd is a little more refined than your average bar-hoppers, think bruno's instead of 7-mile
author: Charles C.

description: Couldn't get enough of this place on our recent trip to SF.  Decently priced beer.  Cool vibe.  Never got overly packed and played good music.  Who could ask for anything more?
author: Kendra M.

description: I love this place during happy hour-ish times (before 8pm) and during the week. I refuse to step foot into this bar after 9pm from Thursday-Saturday.  I hope my friends are reading this and taking mental notes.
author: Sylvia C.

description: It seems like this bar is doing it's best to make you feel as uncool as possible. What? You don't know any of the albums in the jukebox? You are so mainstream, man. Somehow, though, it's still a fun place to be, with good drinks and hot bartenders (sometimes) and I dig the artsy naked chick on the wall. Because nothing says, "this bar is cool" like boobies.
author: Shannon R.

description: blah blah blah- place rocks.   great times.
author: Rob C.

description: Fabulous staff, full of piss & vinegar. Great DJs, music that doesn't irk me. Crowd not my type at all,  so I rarely go to Cassanova unless there's a stool open at the bar. The vibe is pure sex, or maybe that's just me...but I don't think so. I went here on a crazy night with a friend who went to the loo and came back with this totally hot 22 year old that apparently mauled her while she was waiting to pee. Neither of them were lesbians, it just seemed like a good idea for them to make out at the time. I felt really good about the Cassanova that night.
author: Colleen B.

description: The paintings of naked women on the walls have delightfully pointy breasts.
author: Fen Z.

description: The hipster factor was at a level that felt like I was getting slapped in the face with a rusty machete.  However, the place is hella cool.  -Lots of seating.  -Great decor.  The art is proficient, apt, and talented.  This is a place that you go, drink and hang out
author: Jake H.

description:
This bar is considered classy by Mission standards.
its ok.
author: Henry C.

description: Good drink selection, nice laid back funky crowd, reasonable prices, usually excellent DJs (if people messing around with an iPod can be called a DJ) and an exquisite collection of bad art. The acrylic Burt Reynolds (or is it Little Richard?) is my favorite. Pool table is free on Sundays.
author: Stuart J.

description: I've never really liked Casanova, even when I did.
author: Philip M.

description: Good solid drinks, MANY paintings of scantily/non-clad women on the wall that hail from the 70's and some cozy seating in the rear.  My friends called it an emo bar in terms of the crowd it attracted. I dunno. You be the judge on that one.
author: Donna W.

description: Love this place!  Great ,strong margaritas, Hooegarden on tap, and a hot French guy hit on me here this weekend.  What's not to love?  Also, I want that turquoise lamp over the table on the right.
author: Sarah M.

description: I love the music elitist jukebox here--lots of psych rock, Afrobeat, Bollywood, Krautrock, etc.  Bad for people with pedestrian taste in music, and good for people who never see their fine taste represented elsewhere.  Sometimes, the jukebox has a mind of its own; in hours of feeding dollar bills and making selections, it will refuse to play songs we picked, thereby earning our respect as the only machine in the world capable of music snobbery.  Too bad the bar gets filled up with the kind of people who don't give two shits about musical obscurities of the world.  Aside from the fabulous juke, I like this place for the bloody marys garnished with these weird pickled round things...maybe green cherry tomatoes?  I wish there were more bars with obscurist music selections.
author: maiko h.

description: I don't really know how much I like going, but my friends and I always end up here.  Then after about 20 minutes we all leave and go get a burrito.
author: Liz O.

description: heavy hand on the $5 maker's mark, kick ass jukebox, rad dj sets, right in between everything else you wanna do, and DICE. i can even bring my bike inside during happy hour. YES. second-favorite bar in san francisco.
author: Molly A.

description:
i mostly come here to see my friends dj. that's the main cool thing about it.
the naked lady paintings, ehhh, take 'em or leave 'em.
i always do leave here pretty wasted though.
author: Oleya P.

description:
sweet joint. 
always seems to be a space somewhere on one of the couches that you will swear was in a porn from the sixties. 
a sorta local crowd. 
and a stiff 'rita for 7 dineros. yum
author: Jeremi M.

description: I'm in love with the velvet painting of the guy with the mustache.  I can't help but like the vintage glass/plastic grapes from the ceilings.  There's a bartender that always wears the coolest vintage rock tee's as well.  I also got a pitcher of Pabst during happy hour for only $5.  I come here a lot and never leave unsatisfied.
author: Freckles D.

description:
casanova is the an area commonly defined as "the mish", which is of course, NOT to be confused with the mission. i mean, hello. "the mish" can be a lovely assortment of chodes, losers, and hip ass hoes, but at least some of the bars, like casanova, serve a strong and cheap drink. and really, that is all i ever wanted from a bar. 

also, i totally threw up on the floor here once. no one noticed, what?? okay so it was twice.
author: shaine h.

description: Great for people watching.  You can get pitchers of beer here for like $15 (and good beer too).  I heard the boy's bathroom is really gross (but is that really surprising?).  They have interesting paintings on the wall featuring half naked chicks (boobies!).  One girl looks like Michael Jackson in the face.  Not the cleanest of establishments, but fun to come here with your friends for a fun mellow night.
author: Sarah F.

description:
"I once was found, but now I'm lost".. - Casanova Cocktail Lounge.

I think this joint has lost it's mojo... no longer an easy place to stop in for a drink. The bartenders are all rude. The couches and seats are always packed. Everyone has a little attitude. The drinks are getting expensive. Am I in the Marina? No, everyone is wearing tapered black jeans.
author: David F.

description: Aight, this place is do-able Mon through Wed but come on...   The crowds here on the weekends are just obnoxious.  Outside of the ever popular 16th and valencia location (the barmuda triangle) this place doesn't have alot going for it.  I avoid it at all costs thursday through saurday.  If you like to be annoyed by horrible crowds just go to the Beauty Bar instead.
author: jason k.

description: I like the bar tenders.... I like the fact that they don't charge me anything over 10 bucks for scotch... I like the weird seating arrangement... I like the velvet paintings of naked ladies with very long nipples... I like that I see Denise from my french class there ( I see here everywhere in the city though) what I don't like are a majority of the folks there... I am being selfish, but I would much rather have Casanova a chill lounge than a crazy fun packed bar.
author: danny e.

description: Better than the Elbo Room by far, though I gave them the same rating. The space is much smaller and the crowd a little more friendlier. Again, hard to get drinks once it's crowded and they only have one female bathroom stall which is the closest thing I've found to Hell on Earth. I love the decor and going on a night when it's not so packed. In the summer it's fun to sit at the window on a slow night and people watch with a beer and friends.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Not the best, not the worst.  Not really a dive bar, but not swanky.  A true tweener.
author: ellyk E.

description: Cheap drinks, great company, and great service. I'll be back. If you're a native you will most likely run into someone you grew up with here.
author: Heather L.

description: I love the large, smooth bar and red art decco reminiscent of an era before my time. It rocks my night.
author: Alicia J.

description: I very very much love and miss this place. I discovered it almost when I was moving out of SF. This place is great. Way more spacious than the regular mission bar. Great music. Great drinks. Very attractive boys and girls. I have never been to this place on a dull night. I would totally recommend this lounge. It is wonderful! You won't be disappointed. All I have to say against is...the bathroom wait. Waiting for the bathroom here feels like forever. That is my only complaint  but girls always take their time so......waiting is what u gotta do...
author: Berenice D.

description: I love this bar.  The music is awesome and the bizarre grape glass things that hang around the bar are confusing in a good way.  This place has a very strong locals vibe with very few "others" making their way in from the street, so if you want to avoid non-missionites, this is the place to go.  Generally speaking, you can find a table on the weekends, and that, is perfect for those that favor stilettos...
author: Claire C.

description: My friends all seem to like Casanova, but I don't quite get it.  Yes, the naked ladies are sort of hip and sometimes the music is good.  But it's also ridiculously crowded and the last time I went they were blasting metal so loud you couldn't hear anyone.  Also, I normally drink IPA, but the only one they serve on tap is so hoppy it tastes like drinking pot (does anyone know what it is?).  It smelled like someone at our table was lighting up and it my boyfriend had the worst hangover the next day.
author: Katie S.

description: I don't quite know why, but I really love this place. Perhaps it's the really cool lamps hanging from the ceiling that I can never seem to stop staring at or the fact that the drink prices are totally reasonable for SF. I've been twice and the only problem I have with this place is that the music is LOUD and it's a little hard to have a conversation.
author: Kara A.

description: So when waiting for a table for Puerto Alegre this is the spot! It's dark, it's fun, the bar staff is always cool, gotta LOVE Happy Hour specials too! Vintage, velvety type of art work/vibe in there. Just a cool little spot to chill and have a drink or 5!!!!
author: Rob L.

description:
i've only been here once, and if someone gets me drunk enough, i might be able to be coerced into giving it another chance.

the bar itself looked pretty neat (albeit, drunk goggles were on and it was so crowded it was hard to take notice of decor through all of the skanky people). i liked the velvet nudey pictures, and the u-shaped bar was visually pleasing, although it did seem to cause some chaos in the ordering of drinks--NEVER a good thing. can't speak for the quality of mixed drinks as i stuck to a regiment of whiskey and beer.

what turned me off about this place was the aforementioned skanky crowd. now, don't get me wrong, i love a little skeez factor in bars: dirty bathrooms, poor lighting, questionable sanitary conditions don't really bother me. guys wearing shorts and hitting on anything with fallopian tubes, however, bother me quite a bit. what's even worse are the cleavage-showing women who enjoy this attention. sure, the name is casanova, so i probably should have expected the meat market i was entering, but i was not entirely prepared for a certain "bro" element to the place. 

when i go to a bar, i go to drink--i'm not there to drink and flail about in hopes to catch someone's eye. and if i WAS in the mood for picking someone up, this is one of the last places i would choose.
author: Kayla K.

description: The drinks here are f*^%king strong. Pretty chill crowd, good music, and a fair amount of space to sit down. I can see myself coming back here at least a few more times.
author: Srinivas R.

description: Cheap drinks and mixed very well. Good selection of beers on tap! Loved the atmosphere, dark and cozy with orange walls and funky retro lamps hanging from the ceiling. Plenty of seating which was a plus. Female nude paintings are wonderful to look at. I will definitely be coming back here.
author: Cori W.

description: I keep coming here.  I don't know why.  My girlfriend says it's my lack of creativity.  But I say it's the boobs.  There are boobs on every wall.  I like boobs.  The drinks are weak and expensive, but the boobs somehow make up for it.
author: Michael F.

description: Used to be quite a find, now I think it's been a bit exploited. Still great music and interesting people, however. And inexpensive drinks, done mission-style.
author: Risa F.

description:
this is my after work, grab a bloody mary( almost a salad is inlcuded in it ) , then head out to eat at one of the restuarants in the hood.

going early is the key-- laid back, funky atmosphere and killer tunes. 
raves: bloody marys, free drinks for regulars, happenin hood
bummers: too crowded at night, no bloody marys after 7 pm
tidbits: grab some samosas to go from bombay bazaar across the street if you want some good bar grub.
author: CTP p.

description: This  place has a cool vibe, good ambiance and a cool dj, too bad it's ridiculously packed and you can't move an inch. It's the Mission and it wants to give off this cool divey vibe so why do I feel like I'm packed into Eastside West getting the once overed by the oh so arty, hipster crowd. If I want to be judged I'll go to the Marina thank you very much.
author: Cathy T.

description: The long-island ice tea is a bit weak here.  But the great djs/music, naked lady paintings, comfy couches, and dark/reddish lighting entice me.  Another perfect make-out spot ;-)
author: Tiffany L.

description: Of course, how can you not love the "tactful" paints of the circa 1970 ladies on the wall? Oh and those red leather couches... who cares if the drinks are good! They have drinks, nuff' said!
author: Scott T.

description:
i flipping love this place. its my home away from home..i've been to tons of bars in the city..and i always have thee best times here. drinks come fast..the poor is flippin heavy and drinks are cheap ass hell. no one is ever a jerk face and the bartenders are bad asses! 
Its a cute mission dive bar. they always have a DJ in there and the music selection is pretty rad. plays anything from 60s rock and roll to new age punk. non of that rap crap... 
there are always plenty of good looking guys and gals.. 

if you come here, make sure to check out the picture by the men's restroom..it looks like Michael Jackson with huge tits....you'll know exactly what i mean when you see it.
author: Missy M.

description: I almost never come in here, I sort of wander in sometimes to use the bathroom and that's pretty much in. I dropped in last week and noticed they have a bunch of nudie paintaings up everywhere. I never really noticed before because I've never been in longer there than a drink. It's actually pretty cozy inside but once it gets packed there's nowhere to sit so you'll have to just stand there, especially on a weekend nite. Get there early and leave early I suppose...
author: Gina R.

description: Just recently demoted from my favorite nightlife spots due to a RIDICULOUSLY RUDE tender of the bar.  You may get better service if you show up in a hoodie with desheveled hair...ugh!  BUGS!!!
author: Sarah D.

description: Cassanova...or as I like to call it...'The Whores Coffin,' is a hard place to put a finger on. I can credit the establishment one ex-girlfriend, and many an hour waiting for Puerto, but am undecided as to the quality of time spent there. You can always go in and get served up a good dose of reverse pretension - so don't be too cute, or wear something forwardly stylish...else the blue collar fashionista make a hard point of your digs. On the other hand, if I'm having a bad hair day, or want to show off my vintage skull t-shirt, I can usually get a beer without the sideways glance.
author: Nicholas M.

description: Red lighting, it is the rock to dalva's hip hop.
author: Seiji C.

description: It's really the only bar I go to in the Mission, which sucks because I hate this bar.  The bartenders are rude, and call last call at like 115.  But their drinks are affordable, and the ambiance is quite nice.  And it's not a horrible place to go if you're single in the city.  wink wink-nudge nudge
author: Max M.

description: The vibe wasn't right for me at Casanova, but I heard from someone that they had just dropped off a bus load of people who were on some excursion and the place went from comfy and relaxing to overcrowded and smelly...yes, two stink bombs were set-off and it wasn't pleasant.  I did like the look of the place, comfy and spacious.  I'm willing to give it another try, but if I smell another stink bomb, I'm so outta there.
author: vanessa c.

description: Where the wine is cheap and debit cards ain't accepted. The fuzzy naked lady paintings on the walls & glass grape decor make this one of my favorite places to hang out. Don't expect good service or nicey nicey's here, it is a dive bar!!!!!
author: Ingrid K.

description: The last time I was at Cassanova, the bartender closed the bar 30 minutes before last call even though the place was packed.  My friend protested, and they got in a fight.  Expect a crowd of missionites with a chip on their shoulder for everyone there that doesn't live South of Market.  And if you visit from another neighborhood, you'll probably find yourself wondering what you're doing there.
author: Evan A.

description: My experience there has been quite a mixed bag.  On a week night I once stopped in for a beer and the DJ kept spinning jam after jam, plenty of funk and movement.  Othernights its more cliche.  I feel snubbed sometimes by other bar goers and less so staff if I show up with a button down and nice shoes, but that happens plenty in the mission.  Great beer selection though and chill environment.  You may see some ladies smooching in the corner on the couches, which are a nice touch if you are lucky enough to get on one.
author: Grant B.

description: Pretty fun times spent at Casanova Lounge. I've been here for New Year's Eve, and they threw a decent party. On other occasions, it was a stop for one of our bar hopping sessions. Decently priced drinks, great decor, and good vibe.
author: Joy C.

description: You'll immediately notice who the namesake of this bar is when you walk in; it's the portrait of the lone male hanging on the wall to your right, bearing an uncanny resemblance to a mexican Burt Reynolds, happily overseeing his harem of big-bosomed ladies decorating the rest of the interior. You'll also notice that everyone here is noisily drinking and laughing together without a care in the world, just as it was meant to be since booze was born. For people who actually hang out inside the bar, this one is usually perfect as a happy hour meet-up spot or as a jump-off point to the rest of your night. For the rest of us, there's a liquor store on the corner of 16th & Valencia that stays open past the cut-off. Casanova doesn't care if you and your brew lurk outside.
author: Jenn W.

description:
Take a bunch of 70's style paintings of topless ladies, random old light fixtures, relics of the late 60's and early 70's furnishings then throw some liquor on top and you'll get Casanova. I like Casanova just because it's such a magnet for the full spectrum of the Bay Area's inhabitants. True, if you go there at an ungodly hour its packed with the usual suspects and I can only see so many camis and heels and ginormous sunglasses. But I digress. If you go there at an off hour you get a few people on dates. Chicks making out on the red pleather sofa. A lot of times this is a ladies joint if you go to late or too early with less sausage than a vegetarian pizza unless you count my bf who really doesn't count for y'all. Anyhow, I go to Casanova because I can have a few beers and relax. I can sit there and space out on the art or chat with fellow patrons. I go there because it's funky and fun and a little dirty, not unlike most Yelpers. 

P.S.-This was stop number two on the night we began at Dalva. Good times.
author: Jessica D.

description: dunno why people trash this place...I've definitely been to worse bars.  Went on a thursday and was surprisingly crowded (who goes out on thursdays?) Was meeting a blind date there, ended up paying cuz it's cash only  Music was really good-the Who, alot of the Jam, can't go wrong with britrock. The cheesy black velvet nude paintings are good conversation pieces...or conversation stoppers depending on what kinda person you are.
author: Marie W.

description: I prefer Casanova Lounge to it's sister bar the Hemlock.  It's smaller, more intimate and not as pretentious.  That's not to say the Hemlock can't be fun, but maybe it's because I'm older now I prefer these smaller more laid back places.  Sure Casanova Lounge has it's share of too cool for school hipsters.  But that's everywhere.  It's a fun bar with good music and good drinks.  Better to come there with friends and maybe better on the weekdays, depending on what you are looking for.
author: Amanda P.

description: This place is like every other bar in the Valencia corridor, only it has paintings of naked women on the walls.
author: Amy Z.

description: Great bartenders making killer drinks and some even better records spun by friendly DJs. Not a bad night at all...
author: Nicolas H.

description: The nude portraits of the ladies on the wall caught me off guard. Music was good and it was a happening place last Friday night!
author: sonam d.

description: Its nearly perfect location ensures it will always have a bit of business going for it.  Has plenty of seating in the back for lounging around and catching up with friends.  The artwork would make Larry Flynt proud.
author: Tim G.

description: This place is full of nudie paintings, and cool lighting. And they have good music, Racer 5 on tap, a graffed-out scary men's bathroom, and friendly, sexy bartenders. Sold!
author: Maximillian M.

description:
i was in here for about 2 minutes
took a shot of whiskey and left
the place had awesome art work on the walls and seemed pretty chill but just didn't draw me in.
it doesn't mean its a bad place so don't rule it out while bar hopping, but i personally wasn't super excited.
author: Helen N.

description: This place makes me feel ugly. I have to wait forever to order my expensive beer.
author: Brittany L.

description: Perfect location, cheap cocktails, friendly bar staff.  It's sometimes a little crowded = difficult to get up to the bar, but that isn't a bad thing for the bar.  :)  It's usually full of hipsters, typical mission-y steez.  I like this place.  Oh yea...I forgot to mention the velvet nudie paintings on the walls.  Awesome.
author: Emily T.

description: I enjoy the overall vibe and grown man feel of this place SWAG!
author: boy boy l.

description: I love the Casanova and frequent it often, the bartenders are great and the music is top notch, not to mention the FREEE jukebox with ESG on it!  However not on a weekend night, seriously aren't there enough bars in the marina people?  yes I know the 22 does take you here, but really why the Casanova? I recommend week nights and daytime-
author: A. Gun n.

description: It doesn't look like much from the outside, but its what's on the inside that counts. Go inside, grab a beer and take a seat on one of the various comfy couches towards the back of the bar. The red lights and rocking tunes coming from the jukebox are a great way to get your evening in the Mission started.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
this place would be 8 million times more rad if it had more places to sit.I think its really fucking stupid there aren't more places to sit because the standing nightmare when it gets crowded if a dj is spinning blows.


But on a whole i like it.its close to where i live. it has relatively reasonably priced drinks.and my girl solana spins there like every month so i cant complain too much-they have taste!
author: Lauren V.

description: Hip dive bar.  Not as real-time divey as the Gold Dust Lounge on Powell, but not fake dive either.  Good margaritas, which are served in a pint glass and cost $6 (Hornitos tequila).  Draft PBR is a fast $2.50.  We went last night (a Friday) and had none of the service or wait time problems that others have complained about.  Maybe we were just lucky.  Patrons are friendly, bar staff is friendly.  We got seats on the leather couches.  All in all, a very good experience.
author: brewgirl b.

description: Your average dive bar in the Mission.  This place has been around the corner from me for about two years, but this was my first time.  Still a crowd on a Monday night and the music is played so loud that my throat was hoarse from screaming after we left.  Hot pictures of semi and completely naked women on the walls - they definitely need some gender equity in that respect.
author: Joanna S.

description: This place pulls some real Jekyll and Hyde shit.  I once proclaimed this bar my favorite in SF until I got stuck here on a weekend sandwiched between coked out bros (the worst of them being my **********'s boss) and their female counterparts.  On the weekend this place is a total douchebag factory.  Conversely, during the week this place can be a real refuge.  They play great music, have a good atmosphere and make strong drinks.  I guess the bros stay in the marina or are extremely dedicated to their consulting jobs Sunday through Thursday.
author: Chris C.

description: Went there for a single drink and left.  Yuppie hipster wannabes (three of my least favorite things in the world) crowd the area making small talk and using their newly learned hip words (i must of heard "ubiquitous" about 10 times with 3 minutes, a book club must have just gotten out).  Bartenders were cool enough and drinks were priced just about right.  Nothing special by any stretch of the imagination.
author: Daniel M.

description: Interesting "fixtures" here - both of the lighting variety and of the naked women in paintings kind.  I guess that's why the call the place Casanova.  Overall, nice place to just grab a drink and hang out.
author: Naomi N.

description: Fun but a little grimey.  Paintings of voluptuous nakeds everywhere.  I have to give these guys some respect for using Meyer's as the rail rum.  But then again I've got to give them thumbs down for yelling at me for grabbing a beer from outside the bar through their window.
author: Kurosh H.

description: Great spot if you are looking to be part of the indie/hipster crowd.  I thought that the music was great, the chairs were comfy, no lines for the bathroom, and best of all the drinks were CHEAP!  Seriously, next round is on me.
author: Kim C.

description: Going to the Mission area, Casanova is always the place we stroll into in order to  "break the seal." We usually hit places like the Elbo Room, Cha Cha Cha, and Delerium to get plastered; but for some absurd resason, there is something hypnotic about the deep crimson colored ambiance that makes us go into the lounge and use their restroom. I don't know. I think it has to be with their location or maybe it's because one of my buddies always says "hey that place looks poppin and red...we should go inside." I don't know! Cool place! Had a beer there!
author: Joel V.

description: Pretty nice place. Was here after a late lunch for happy hour. $1 off drinks. There were only a couple other people inside who were pretty quiet. The bartender was a smaller chick with dark hair who hooked up the drinks. The atmosphere is pretty cool. Once you stray away from the bar area there's velvet walls, couches, paintings of naked ladies. Very chilled out, at least early evening/late afternoon.
author: Chris W.

description: Casanova is great place to start the night and wait for friends to meet. The crowd can be diverse and steadily changes as people hop in and out for drinks, friends, whatever. You can stand in the front bar area or grab a seat in the back lounge (perfect if your friends are running really late). Either way, there is a cool laid-back vibe to Casanova and the bartenders always pour a strong vodka tonic.
author: Abigail R.

description: velevet paintings, leather couches.  dark lighting.  perfect.  The place is full of hipsters, but the aloof, stuck- up attitude is usually not to be found.  maybe the lighting in the place phychologically makes people less pretentious.  Maybe it's the booze.  I've never had a shitty time here.  The bartenders treated everybody equally welcome and they bust their ass, so tip them.
author: Dan S.

description: Go for Happy Hour and with great beer & Cocktail prices, music at lower volume, and a cool easy unpretentious vibe.
author: Amber W.

description:
what do i have to do to get a drink at this place????!!!???

other than the crappy service, casanova is a pretty chill place if you're looking to have some drinks in a mission-esque, but tame environment. 

gotta love the paintings of nude women from the 70s on the walls.
author: rachface -.

description: If Bar 821 is my first date bar, then Casanova lounge is my 2nd date bar.  I usually only hit up Casanova during happy hour, when I know that I can grab a seat on the couch, and manage to have some good conversation before it gets really loud inside.  I will say that it is a pain in the ass getting the bartenders attention (empty or not empty) to get a drink.
author: Jasmine B.

description:
wacky naked mamasitas on the wall.
wacky movies projected on the wall.
scary, you-will-be-raped bathrooms.

i dont know what to make of this place.

but it DID make my colleague realize why
he and i frequent Delerium so much. (the regal beagle)
places like Delerium have more of a dance environment
and tend to encourage mingling because of the set up.

casanova is more of a classic bring your date/gang here
and huddle somewhere and chill. 

i have to go here a few more times to give a proper review.

end transmission.
author: JT X.

description:
What's with that 70's hipster look guys are sporting in the mission?...ugh...plenty of this in there.
Other than that this is great spot for a drink after work. Margaritas are loaded and poured in Beer glasses. YuM....and cheap
author: Nico L.

description: Casanova is a good time. A dive with some attempt at interesting design (quirky 70s pendant lamps, velvet sofas, and a handful of nude paintings), that reminds me a lot of New Orleans, which I love. A good mix of people, mostly a young crowd, and an occasional sketchball. People seem to be coming in and out all night, which is fun. It's also not too expensive. At times it's too packed, which is a bummer. But if you can snag a seat or bar stool, or a few square feet of personal space to stand, you're likely to enjoy yourself.
author: Julia W.

description: This place can get mighty packed on the weekend but that still shouldn't stop you from starting a dance train in the middle of the sitting area.  Drinks, yeah they've got them, but it's all about the music at this place.  Excellent bar to end up at if you're hopping around the mission.
author: Collin S.

description:
great atmosphere. very red! music is hip. never seems too crowded even when it is. bartenders aren't anything unusual. except one looks like Juno from 'The Descent' which i find very hot!! this place should really only be 3 stars but something about it makes it 4. i can't pinpoint it.

it's probably Juno.
author: Daniel N.

description: I really dig this bar for what it is.  Have spent a few happy hours here and it is an actual bargain.  Minus one start since they got rid of the pool table, but it does get pretty crowded at night so I can see why they would.  Still, boo.
author: e w.

description: Normally, I check out Casanova on weekends but last night, my friend and I decided to stop by Casanova for a place to chat.  It was actually very mellow not the usual weekend crazy crowds.  It was nice to be able to hear our conversation w/out having to shout.  One thing through, the bar tender was hard to find even on a slow night.
author: figster f.

description: What makes this place ace - the bartenders.  Some of the raddest sistahs and brothers that serve em up with style.  Although I prefer a weekday visit, I've often found (or lost) myself there on Fridays, right after work, before the 8pm crowd moves in.  The music usually rocks and even gets the masses movin' from time to time.  Killer margaritas and bloody marys.  I find no reason to give this place any less than my high five!
author: Ranch S.

description: My roomie and I started to frequent this joint after seeing how crazy crowded it began to get on weekends. Gotta love the Smish! You are likely to meet friendly awesome people at Casanova, even if it takes a smidgen longer to get your drink than at other fine local establishments.
author: Natalia P.

description: There are so many better places in this neighborhood to grab a drink.  Both times I've been here, the bartenders seem put out to make you a drink.  This crowd didn't seem to be having fun, and there is no atmosphere really.  Basically, expect to stand in a crowded space with lots of people staring at each other blankly; the bad music is played too loud so conversation is a lost cause.  I'd go elsewhere.
author: Wino K.

description: Perfect place during the week if you live in the mission, stay away during the weekend though that's when the Marina kids come to "slum it". The atmosphere is sexy,surly, and ecclectic. The jukebox is big mix from Alice Cooper, Spoon,Wire....The Dj's play intelligent, fun jams. The barkeeps do their job, get you drunk. The Nova is a neighborhood bar if it's not for you-go to Blondies across the street.
author: erika G.

description:
as i sit in the back on the couch... on the stage... behind the drawn back curtain...  all i can imagine is the nsync video "bye bye bye" where they were marionettes.

takes a while for a drink, but the happy hour margs are worth it.

::good people watching::
author: tiff f.

description: not my kind of bar at all... a bit too on the grungy side and i'm not just talking about the bar. if that's your style, you might enjoy but i did not.
author: Michelle I.

description: liked this spot a lot. found a seat at the bar. the bartenders were all very nice and good looking. i don't remember the music, although it might have been some metal. some douche spilled a beer all over me, but that was the worst part of the night. i liked the decorations and the lighting here and there was a good crowd on Saturday night.
author: Joanne S.

description: Not to be overly cynical (ha), but San Francisco is a microcosm of the globe's rich history of colonization and exploitation.  Just as the europeans set sail in clipper ships on their way to colonize the South Americans and the rest of the southern hemisphere during the 17th and 18th centuries, so go the Marina-ites of the 21st century, launching themselves in late model A4's and BMW's on exciting voyages to the Mission (also largely South American) on weekend nights to pilage, colonize and exploit the Southern Hemisphere of San Francisco.  Remarkably similar cultures, neither the Europeans or the Marina-ites are capable of staying in their own territory or country.  Did the indigenous people of Africa and South America try to colonize Europe? (Well, they certainly didn't go back happily or voluntarily.)  And how often do you see your Mission indie chicks and rockers or their latin compadres out for a swingin' night at Cozmo's or Eastside West?!
author: Rick H.

description: i didn't get the "hair" comments until I went to this bar for a drink after work on saturday night. i'm waiting for the bartender with Ken and Buffy sitting at the bar in front of me. i try to manuever around the perfume bathed Buffy as she flips her over highlighted hair right into my face. gaggg. But..I like the cheesy 60s decor and the naked ladies painted on velvet. Perhaps you can sneak a pill into Buiffys drink next time and send her ass over to Blondies accross the street.
author: City G.

description: weekends here a little too amateur night at the apollo for me.  i tend to saddle up to the bar sunday through thurs.  the music is great and the drinks are long and tall.
author: Antichris E.

description: I love bars that have places to sit. The naked lady paintings were interesting. A little too loud to hear though especially in back. People like to dance in the front near the bar area, so the layout is a bit weird.
author: Retired B.

description: i had some reservation about this place originally but a friend wanted to have some birthday drinks so i went, i was immediately enamored by all of the lovely velvet paintings and the strange plastic light fixtures, it was a good situation, although i have to say a vinyl couch on a hot hot night is not the best combo
author: Jared Z.

description: Holy shit. I totally had a lesbian experience here too. And it was in the bathroom too.  I had a blonde girl hitting on me all night despite the fact that I told her I was straight and that I don't make out with girls to impress guys.  When the evening was coming to a close and I had had a bitchload of whiskey I tried to call her bluff and asked if she wanted to make out in the bathroom.  She wasn't bluffing and I don't bitch out. Nuff said.  Besides that I liked this place, it had a cool and mellow DJ. Stiff drinks and a nice dank atmosphere.  Just don't go making any gambles and you'll be fine.
author: Vanessa G.

description: reasonable drinks, leather couches (so you can lie to yourself and pretend they wipe them down) pics of naked ladies. red walls, my fave color.  sometimes the music sucks and is too loud but not too shabby overall.
author: kiki b.

description: I wasn't really impressed. I went here recently on a night of bar hopping with friends, and we stopped in here briefly because apparantly someone really liked the place. It pissed me off for several reasons. Once I got to a certain point in the bar, it was impossible to move in any direction. Not a good thing, since I REALLY had to pee. When I finally headed in the direction of the bathroom after feeling like I was in some sort of a twisted jigsaw puzzle, there was a line of 7 women outside the door. With no choice but to stand in said line, I did, only to find out that once you actually get in the door, there are 3 or 4 MORE women inside waiting. Horseshit. Once I finally got to go and get the hell out of there, I returned to my friends and attempted to jostle my way through to the bar (to no avail). Thankfully, my friends decided to migrate shortly after. Sheesh. The place is decorated pretty well, and it did warrant a pretty funny comment out of a fairly drunk friend of mine when we were there. Thus the extra star. Maybe on our next night bar hopping on Valencia, I'll check this place out again. Maybe.
author: Lindsey S.

description: casanova is a rad hang. good tunes, rad bartenders, and generally good crowd (weekdays are better IMO). glad they got rid of the pool table too...nice one.
author: dusty d.

description: so many reviews, so i don't have a ton to add. love the fact that they have pitchers (and super cheap pitchers during happy hour!--less than $10!) of racer 5. definitely a great place to come and chill out for a few hours, especially before it gets super crowded.
author: Monica C.

description: the only saving grace of this place is they poor a long shot of fernet every time i go.  but it is to crowded and the bar tenders are not the friendliest in the world.  yet i find my self down here once or twice a month.  strange...
author: brian m.

description: i love this bar. i love the lighting. i love the mood it puts me in. i love the comfy couches. i even love just milling around. i feel like i might bump into people i love, too.
author: julia r.

description: Cinco de Mayo plans a bust, we mosied into Casanova in desperate need of tequila.  They had pint size & strong margaritas for $5 that hit the spot : )  We were able to snag a tabletop near the window for our group so we had to chance to watch everyone saunter in.  I honestly think I found my favorite hood that night, because everyone walking in or walking by was stellar.  The men were polite, kept the ogling to a minimum, and seemed to actually be digging their companions convos and not just looking for ass.  The women were beautiful, as their outfits all had a touch of spunk, a bit of class, and they carried themselves with a confidence that didn't come from how expensive their "tote" was.  I actually had the coolest thing happen to me in the restroom:  I was waiting in line and a chick came out with a tallboy Tecate.  I was shocked and asked if they were selling those but she said they just couldn't wait for the bartender, who I admit was slow and snooty.  I told her how cool that was and entered the stall.  All of a sudden, she slipped an unopened tallboy under the door and told me to enjoy!!  I was completely floored!!  I mean, who does that??  It totally made my night and I had to hunt her down to let her know.  Of course, it didn't take long for the bouncer to take it away because of my lack of covertness but I was on a humanity high all night long regardless.  There's nothing better than meeting another happy person spreading the wealth : )
author: Tara G.

description: it's always too crowded in here for me. and one time when i was sitting on the couch, this girl sat on the other side of it with her thong sticking out of her jeans wayyyy too close to my head. plus the bathrooms are gross. no thanks.
author: Melanie C.

description: This happens to be the easiest meeting place thus far for my friends of late.  I agree it's a relatively easy meeting place if you don't have to drive.  Give it up if you don't already have it down that parking in the Mission is pretty much just dumb.  Not available, not safe, not eco-friendly.  So don't.  Beyond that I can walk here, so I don't need to drive!  I don't know what all the fuss is about but most people seem to like it, it's good if you have a group of people around 6-8, but much more than that the feng-shui gets bad.  It's one of the few places that likes to pride itself on being a "lounge" so music-wise they try to stick to this theme.  And the red plush environs mixed with the provocative scantily clad portraits of women help it live up to it's name.  The drinks are good, nothing fancy or complicated.  It definitely falls more on the 'dive-bar' side than the 'upscale' bar, but let's just leave it at lounge.  Mid-range place, good meeting spot.  Enough said.
author: Lara L.

description: i didn't spend all that much time here, but the music was good.  also, for such a grungy looking place (and location), the women's bathroom was pretty clean.
author: Roshni R.

description: this place is eh...  it's too loud and way too crowded.  everyone should go to doctor after checking out the bathroom cuz god knows what you'll pick up by doin your bidness in here.  i supposed the paintings make a great conversation, that is if you can even hear your friends that you are with...
author: Swarup B.

description: i'm only giving casanova 3 stars because they don't take check card. i had a ton of fun there and liked the easiness of the setting, but not taking check card is like denying patrons of fun. not accepting credit cards is nostalgic but it is also a pain in the ass. it is like waiting in line for a movie you really want to see, but you find out it gets sold out just before your turn. i was forced to resort to other methods when i bought those 10 shots for a total of $70. good thing i bought 10 for the 8 of us. luckily, i had some american green backs and borrowed from matt to make up for a tip. when i whipped out my wells, the bartender said, "cash only. there's an atm over there." it is nice there is alternative for non cash carriers to use in this plastic-era movement.
author: Susan A.

description: Very lad back atmosphere attracting a xixed crowed. Music last Saturday was of my liking.  I did not see a DJ so they must have been playing mp3s or Cds.  Shots were huge, almost 50% more than a standard shot.  They were very skimpy on the chasers though.
author: Joseph V.

description: Casanova.  This place is actually pretty nice.  The art pieces on the wall are cool (I wanted to take one home!).They've got a little area for dancing and in the back they got couches where people can talk and do some people watching.  Overall, I recommend coming here with a group of friends.  Oh yeah, this is a lounge so no freak dancing or dropping it like its hot, it's just not that type of place.
author: David P.

description: everytime i walk in, i walk right out. i always get the feeling the urban outfitters convention bus just pulled in. could be just the weekends. i'll have to check it out on the weekdays.
author: Adrienne Y.

description: Everything seems right about this bar but it's never very much fun.  I'm thinking the small area that the bar takes up relative to the whole space is just wrong.  We gotta feel like the alcohol is easy access, right?  And somehow this place gets crowded, even though it's just a random bar.  Pretty much I'm just confused by this place.
author: Nate B.

description: Hands down, my fave SF night time bar for years (gotta get your white trash on at Zeitgeist during the day). I love the darkness, the decor and especially the drinks and service. This place is pretty much the Ruby Room's older, much tackier, slutty sister with a better record collection. I am not big on DJs either but this is the only place I have found where the DJ's ACTUALLY have real taste and play pretty obscure garage and psych because they love it- NOT because they think it's the hip thing to do (NOTE: I think it depends on whose DJing on a particular night though, too be fair). Now some people are turned off by Cassanova, convinced its some kind of hipster bar!? That is crazy, this place is just a fun spot of regular folks who dig the same kind of bar vibe and there is absolutely no pretentiousness in the air. Although I admit, sometimes the movie-a-go-go that's chosen to play on screen can get a little clich Still, its better than whats usually showing on a bar big screen anywhere else. If you haven't been here yet but always in the area, shame on you! I can't really recommend another bar in the Mission that even comes close.
author: Dolores A.

description: naked ladies on the wall and black butte porter on tap. yay.
author: Paul Q.

description: nice bar to grab a drink pre or post dinner...i like to get the couch all the way in the back, it faces out and you can people-watch.  minus two stars for the gnarly bathroom.
author: lily k.

description: packed.  but  we got seats at the bar easily.  lots of people excited to be there.   the night was kinda hazy, so it might've liked this place more than i should.
author: Richard Y.

description: The Casanova is one of those places that I've been going to since I first came to SF well over a decade ago, and with all the changes I've gone through, it still suits me. Back in the mid to late nineties, I was educated on rock n roll from what continues to be the most amazing jukebox in the city, and it consistently has the best, most passionate rock n roll djs. The fact that on the weekends you have this clueless bridge and tunnel crowd just kind of makes it more interesting. Seeing Fast Eddy on a cigarette break trying to pick up on bubbly blonde girls who look like they just stepped out of Wet Seal is a sight to behold. Dylan profoundly stated to his love in a song "I can't help it if you think I am odd, if I say I'm lovin' you not for what you are but what you're not." Maybe in the same way I love this place because of what it is not. It's not a Marina frat party filled with investment bankers, and it's not the Zeitgeist, which tries so hard to be punk it alienates it's own patrons (Fast, Friendly, Service...pick one?). How 'bout I pick a real bar? Casanova. The velvet naked women paintings, the dimmed red lights, the speakers dripping with reverb...this place is like going back to the womb.
author: Terry S.

description: This bar has a lot of thick black rimmed spectacles upon it's patrons. It is a good place for some heavy drinking and good music. I have been here thrice and the bar staff have been consistently slow, but you can stare at breasts and even some vaginae in the paintings on the walls while you wait.
author: Andrew C.

description: Walk straight back into Casanova and take a look to the right. The only bar in the city with a giant black velvet painted sexy naked lady picture with the face of Michael Jackson. I like this bar alright.
author: Becki L.

description: A-ok. This bar seems douchy upon first impression, and that impression will last, however, if you are at all observant, you will notice the dedicated regulars at the bar too. Those folks are not douchy, and judging from their appearance, there must be some magic in the flat beer they're serving up there, because they have not aged a day in the eleven years that I've been stopping in for an unrefreshing drink. The boob art collection is nice, the chesterfield couches are nice, the smell is not so nice. This place will never change, neither will the smell as long as they have carepeting. That is except for the couple of changes that did happen, like the sad disappearance of the sparkly curtain wall from the stage seating, and they never turn the juke box on anymore because there are always DJs. They have one of the best juke boxes in town. They also got rid of the pool tables and the little fake fireplace. I don't know why they had to get rid of the little fake fireplace??
author: Sophia L.

description: it's a great neighborhood bar - i don't think it's grungy at all, but then again, i like spending only single digits for my cocktails. pool table is gone and replaced by massive leather couches - which i actually like. normally, i'm not a fan of couches at the bar b/c they stink, but these seem relatively clean and makes me feel at home.
author: J K.

description: unpretentiously hip crowd, nice bartender, comfortably spacious. what more could you ask for
author: Erica C.

description: good vibe, really chill, decent prices. nothing to complain about.
author: cr b.

description: "i would say for the most part this place is great for happy hour. but, apart from that, it gets scary after 8 pm w/ yups and uggs crowding in and generally being stupid. the bloody marys are delicious, so that's why this place gets 4 stars.
author: michelle b.
